She works making traditional textiles by hand.  She has done this work for many years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase materials to make traditional textiles.  She hopes that this will support her business so that it can continue forward.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make traditional textiles.

loans.name: Celedonia Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MICAELA BASTIDAS,el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Celedonia tiene 54 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza la socia vende lo que son cremas,perfumes,colonias entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende de forma independiente a sus amistades,familiares y clientes que le solicitan,a la vez la socia es cosmetologa,la socia elabora diferentes tipos de cortes y teñidos de cabello,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta  forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de perfumes para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank called Micaela Bastidas.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

Celedonia is 54 years old, she is married, and she has 4 children.  She works daily selling beauty products.  She sells creams, perfumes, colognes, and other similar items.  She has worked in this business for many years and it has gone well because she works hard every day.  She sells her items independently to her friends, acquaintances, and customers that she has done business with previously.  At times she works as a cosmetologist and she also cuts and styles hair.  She is a very responsible and hard-working person, and because of this, she helps her family get ahead.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy perfumes for her business.  She is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Rios De Bendicion Group

texts.es: Dúo Rios de Bendición, Este Grupo está integrado por la señora Ofelia de 51 años de edad ella se a dedicado desde hace muchos años atras a la crianza de animales de diferentes clases solo asi a podido sacar adelante a su familia, le da gracias a Dios por haberle dado la oportunidad de un credito ya que lo necesita para la compra de mas animales para la crianza y ya cuando estan grandes venderlos para obtener mejores ganacias, desde ya les agradese la ayuda brindada.
texts.en: Ofelia is a member of the Dúo Rios de Bendición group.  She is 51 years old and has worked for many years raising different types of animals in order to support her family.  She gives thanks to God for giving the opportunity to take out this loan since she needs to purchase more animals to raise.  When they are grown she will sell them and obtain more income.  She is grateful for the help provided.

loans.use: to purchase animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Al-Enshaat Group

texts.en:
The committee of women named "Al-Enshaat" has been in existence as a group for many years. The group consists of four women. They all enjoy working and participating in their businesses. They are from Hodiedh, Yemen. They are all friends and are always cooperative when they work because they want to help their families. 

They applied for a loan of 60,000 YER (Yemen rials). One of the members is Msbah. She is 25 years old and a married woman and has two children. They live together in Hodiedh, Yemen. 

Msbah is a person who is known for being an entrepreneur and a hard worker. She is a woman who adorns brides with henna. She started her business with her sister, and together they are professionals in this business. She has been in this business for four years. She requested a youth loan of 15,000 YER from AMB to buy henna for her business.

loans.use: to buy henna for her business of adorning brides with henna.

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es: Aidee de 49 años, es una mujer joven y muy trabajadora. Convive con su pareja desde hace muchos años con quien tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores, y dos de ellos, de 22 y 20 años de edad viven con ella. El trabajo de Aidee consiste en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene su pequeño negocio en su casa, se dedica a tiempo completo y se siente muy contenta por sus ventas. Recibe el apoyo de su cónyuge y de sus hijos y eso le permite contar con el tiempo suficiente para realizar algunas funciones básicas en su hogar. Abastece su negocio de manera semanal comprando en los centros comerciales de la ciudad. Lleva realizando su trabajo desde hace 5 años y lo que le gusta es que produce sus ingresos económicos sin que esto le demande un excesivo esfuerzo. Le esta yendo bien ya que tiene buenos ingresos que le permiten pagar puntual sus cuotas, por tanto desea ampliar su negocio, para así ahorrar y derivar en mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Este es el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, espera poder cumplir con las exigencias de la institución y de su grupo y así poder ser una buena socia que pague a tiempo, hasta el momento el grupo le va muy bien con su grupo y espera seguir así. El monto solicitado de 2000, con ello comprará abarrotes como 1 saco de arroz, azúcar, 3 cajas de leche chica, pan, huevos, aceites, plátano, cebollas, harina, verduras y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Aidee, age 49, is a very hard-working young woman.  She has lived with her life partner for many years, and they have four adult children.  Two of them, ages 22 and 20, live with them.

Aidee sells groceries.  She has a small business in her house.  She works full time, and she is very happy about her sales.  She receives help from her husband and her children.  This allows her to have enough time to do some basic household chores.  She stocks her store weekly by making purchases at the city’s commercial centers.  

She has been doing this work for five years.  The thing she likes about it is that it produces income without demanding excessive effort.  It is going well for her because she gets good income, which allows her to make her payments punctually.  Therefore, she wishes to expand her business.  She will do this in order to save, which will result in improving the infrastructure of her house.

This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she expects to be able to live up to the requirements of the institution and her group.  This way she will be able to be a good member and make her payments on time.  So far she is doing very well with her group, and she hopes to continue in this manner.  The requested 2,000 soles is to buy groceries like one sack of rice, sugar, three cartons of milk, bread, eggs, cooking oil, bananas, onions, flour, vegetables, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy groceries like one sack of rice, sugar, three cartons of milk, bread, eggs, cooking oil, bananas, onions, flour, vegetables, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Raimunda

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Raimunda, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa en su comercio de golosinas, las cuales vende en un modulo ambulante frente al mercado de su comunidad. Raimunda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como dulces, galletas, chocolates bebidas gaseosas etc. para capitalizar su comercio y con sus ingresos económicos seguir construyendo su casa que es el principal objetivo y sueño de la socia.
Raimunda está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Raimunda is a member of Las Triunfadoras community bank, which is located in the Andahuaylillas district in the Quispicanchis province of Cusco, Peru.  She continues her business selling candy as a street vendor across from the market in her community.  

Raimunda is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as candy, cookies, chocolates, drinks, and sodas in order to capitalize her business.  With her income she will continue building her house, which is her main goal and dream.  

Raimunda is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue with her business so that she can support her household.

loans.use: to purchase candy, cookies, chocolates, drinks, and sodas.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 59-year-old married woman who has 6 family members from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 Jordanian Dinars (JOD) to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy some household items and do maintenance of the home. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Dalal prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her brother. Dalal is a 47-year-old married woman who has 5 family members from Ashrafia Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinars (JOD) to pay for improvements to her home. She would like to buy a new piece of furniture and some household items to improve her family's living standards. She hopes in the future to do maintenance of the home.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Ms Basheeran is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of seven. She is an active woman and has had a business manufacturing carpets for the past 6 years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors, and has become famous in providing good quality carpets in her community. She is able to handle her family needs and requirements efficiently. 

Her husband is employed in a small general store and earns insufficient income to meet the needs of the family members alone. Basheeran must help to provide her children with good quality food and education. To help her to continue her operations she requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and other fibers to increase her sales. She wishes to use part of the profits on her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Wafa'a

texts.en: Wafa'a is 32 years old, married and lives in the town of  Al Hashmi, Jordan. She has three children and is requesting a loan for 900 JOD to buy clothing to sell to her customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future by opening her own shop. Her goal is to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jesus Es El Camino Y La Verdad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JESUS ES EL CAMINO Y LA VERDAD”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Senovia, la socia es conviviente y tiene 35 años y tiene 5 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida ,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia ,a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas ,la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz y aceite.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de llamadas telefónicas, crianza de animales, tienda de abarrotes, venta de mates frescos, venta de relojes.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Senovia is married, she is 35 years old, and she has 3 children.  She works daily selling food from her food cart.  She has worked for many years in this business and the business has gone very well thanks to her hard work.  Sometimes she works raising small animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She raises these small animals so that she can sell them to her customers.  She is a very hard-working and responsible person, and because of this she has helped her family get ahead.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy supplies for her business, such as rice and oil.  The other members of this group work in various businesses such as selling telephone calls, raising animals, running grocery stores, selling beverages, and selling watches.  The members in this photo on the bottom right-hand side asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work.

Senovia is thankful to everyone that has a part in helping her realize her dream, and she promises to comply with the repayment schedule that has been established.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business, such as rice and oil.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 45 years old, married, and very hard working. She is not educated, but is a very intelligent woman who has efficiently run a general store for eight years. She offers items needed for daily use, and has gained many regular customers. 

Unfortunately, Azra faced a very difficult time as her husband, who is employed in the labor field, was not making sufficient income to meet the needs of his family. As a responsible mother of six, Azra wanted to provide her children with a quality education. This is why she is working with her husband to contribute to the family's income. 

Azra has been in association with Kashf Foundation for four years, and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Due to the lack of money, she is currently unable to meet the demands of her customers. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy flour, sugar, rice, and other items for her store, in order to consistently meet the demands of her customers. This will enable her to earn more income and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and rice for her store

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 44-year-old energetic and diligent woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan along her husband, four sons and daughter. Her husband is a stonemason and one son works as a tailor in a tailoring shop. 

Naseem is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2002 she has operated her own beauty salon. Her daughter is also a beautician and helps her mother in the business. Currently the beauty stock of the salon is almost finished therefore Naseem wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. For that as a member of 9-person lending group she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipstick, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors and some other variety of products. With the profit she will extend her business more by opening one more beauty salon. 

She dreams to live a happy healthy and peaceful life with her family. Many thanks best wishes to all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan from her. Note: In the picture Naseem holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Iman prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Iman is a 21-year-old married woman from Ashrafia Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 Jordanian Dinars (JOD) to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy a new piece of furniture and some household items, and also to do maintenance of the home. In the future she hopes to buy new electronic appliances.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoe-making materials

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Ms. Perveen is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives in the village of Phool Nagar with her husband and two children. She has been in the business of clothing sales for many years. Her husband is a shopkeeper and was the only earner of the family, so she decided to help her husband by making some earning, too. For this purpose she purchased some ladies' clothing and started to sell. She gained a lot of customers and become well known in her community. She is contributing enough to provide for her family. In order to purchase more winter clothes in large quantities, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested for a loan of amount 20,000 PKR.  She is hopeful to get an increase in her income and wishes to spend part of profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of winter clothes in large quantities.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 54-year-old widow. She is a very hard worker and the mother of four children. After the death of her husband, she initiated her business of milk sales by purchasing a buffalo three years ago.  Her elder son works in a factory and is the only other earner of family. The income of her son was not enough to fulfill the necessities of life. She is responsible for bearing the expenses of her children’s education and medical requirements.

In order to cater more customers she needs to purchase another buffalo, so she has requested for a loan of amount 30,000 PKR. The additional buffalo will increase her sales which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 47-year-old married female from Sahab in Jordan, and has three children.

Amal has requested an 800 JOD loan to pay for clothes to sell. In the future, Amal is planning to have her own shop and improve the financial situation and living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Siempre hay deseos de superación y de entregar lo mejor de nosotros, nunca es tarde para tener visiones y sueños y estos poder superarlos. Un ejemplo de eso es esta clienta ya que es muy trabajadora y emprendedora siempre con sueños y desea ofrecer un futuro alejado de la violencia social que actualmente sufren los jóvenes hijos como de la edad que posee. Actualmente vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos su razón de ser día a día. Se dedica a vender maíz tostado y pupusas cada mañana se levanta con entusiasmos para vender con esfuerzo y alegría gracias a su manera de ser, se ha hecho de abundante clientela y es muy reconocida por la zona donde reside por su ejemplo de superación. El cliente desea aumentar su venta pero no posee el capital suficiente es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así poder comprar materia prima como maíz, arroz, aceite, queso, frijoles entre otros. Agradece anticipadamente la ayuda y confía en Dios poder realizar su sueño con éxito.
texts.en:
It's never too late to have visions and dreams of self-improvement and of giving our best.  This client is an example of this.  She's very hardworking and enterprising, always dreaming and wanting to provide a future that is far removed from the social violence that young children must endure today.

Currently she lives with her life partner and children, her reason for living every day.  She makes a living selling roasted corn and "pupusas" [stuffed tortillas].  She gets up every day enthusiastically to sell happily and with hard work.  Thanks to her personality she has acquired a lot of customers and is very well known in the area where she lives for her example of self-improvement.

She wants to increase her sales but doesn't have sufficient capital, so she approached Integral for a loan to be able to buy corn, rice, oil, cheese, beans, and other raw materials.  She's grateful in advance for the help and she has faith in God of being able to realize her dream successfully.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, oil, cheese, beans, and other raw materials

loans.name: Abdoh

texts.en:
Abdoh is a 29-year-old single male from Jubaiha in Jordan. He has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for buying the tools needed to open a barber shop for men in his house. in the future, Abdoh is planning to open his own shop separate from his home.

Since Abdoh is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for opening a barber shop for men in his house

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: For cultural reasons, Amani prefers that her photo not appear the Internet, so here we see a photo of husband. Amani is 27 years old, married and lives in the town of Al Khaledieh, Jordan. She has two children and is requesting a loan for 500 JOD to pay for home improvements and to buy furniture for her bedroom and living room. in the future, Amani is planing to add more rooms to her house and start her own project to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Dúo Luz Brillante Group

texts.es: Dúo Luz Brillante, Doña Maria Luisa es originaria de tecpan Guatemala ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos tipicos a mano ella empeso su negocio desde hace años y gracias a Dios ha Salido adelante su negocio a prosperado y ya tiene su propia clientela que lo busca por su producto el Sueño de ella es poder ampliar más su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y asi mandar a sus hijos a una mejor escuela para un futuro mejor.ella ya tubo un credito anterior y estubo puntual y no cayo en mora,esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos tipicos a mano.
texts.en:
“Brilliant Light” Duo.

María Luisa is originally from Tecpan, Guatemala.  She works weaving traditional textiles by hand.  She started her business years ago and thanks to God her business has moved forward and prospered since she has her own clientele that seeks her out for her products.  Her dream is to be able to expand the business more to earn higher profits and send her children to a better school for a better future.  She’s had a previous loan and was punctual with it; she had no late payments.  She’s requesting this loan to buy raw materials to hand weave traditional fabrics.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave traditional textiles by hand.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Ms. Azra is 48 years old, married and works as a teacher. Her son, who is standing next to her, earns a living by running a beauty parlor. He has been in this business for seven years and is well known in his community. It was difficult for Azra to fulfill the needs of her 10-person family, so her son went into business to help her out. In order for her son to serve more customers, Azra is requesting a loan for Rs 20,000 to help him buy more equipment and skin care products. Her son hopes to earn more money so that he can pay for his sister's wedding and the education of his siblings.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is 34 years old, married and lives in Jubaiha Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan for 500 JD to buy women's and children's clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors. She hopes that expanding her inventory of products will allow her to meet her goal of opening a shop and providing her family with a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Dúo Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Dúo Santa Ana: Ofelia de 37 años de edad originaria de Aldea Santa Ana,ella se dedica a la elaboración de refacciones,(panes con pollos etc,)ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 12 años y gracias a eso ella junto con sus hijos han podido salir adelante, ella está solicitando este créditos para la compra de productos comestibles para la elavoración de refacciones, espera que le puedan ayudar con su negocio para que ella pueda salir adelante.
texts.en: Duo Santa Ana: Ofelia is 37 years old and is originally from Santa Ana Village. She works making snacks (breads with chicken etc.) and she has been doing this activity for the last 12 years which has allowed her and her children to get ahead. She is applying for this loan to buy groceries to make snacks and she hopes that it will help her with her business so she can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the production of snacks.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Catalina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa en el negocio de venta de comida de forma ambulatoria. Catalina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, verduras, carnes, fideos etc. para la elaboración de sus alimentos.
Catalina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en: Catalina is a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Victorious Ones) communal bank in Andahuaylillas District, Quispicanchis Province in Cusco, Peru.  She continues with her business selling food from place to place.  On this occasion, Catalina needs the loan to buy ingredients like rice, vegetables, meat, noodles, etc. to make her food.  Catalina is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to stay in business and by means of this work to provide support for her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, meat, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoe-making materials

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 29-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to buy used furniture to resell and to expand her product offering. She hopes in the future to expand her project, to buy a car, and to continue her education. 

Since Iman is under 30 year old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy used furniture to resell

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, tiene 49 años, es una mujer muy empeñosa y trabajadora, convive desde hace muchos años con su pareja y junto a él tiene 3 hijos. Vive junto a su familia y hermana en su casa propia que obtuvo gracias al esfuerzo conjunto de las personas que comparten su vivienda. Nuestra amiga Olga se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Su trabajo consiste en poner a la venta los principales productos de primera necesidad y consumo diario, vende arroz, azúcar, huevos, panes, plátano, tomate cebolla y otros. Tiene su negocio en un espacio que acondicionó en propia casa y trabaja todos los días brindado una atención cálida y amable. Lleva en ésta actividad más de 6 años y gracias a ello puede cubrir las necesidades  básicas de sus hijos y de su familia en general. Se siente muy contenta porque colabora con el aporte económico en su hogar y cada día sus ingresos mejoran, aunque algunas veces pensó en desistir por que no se acostumbraba al horario de atención durante todo el día y muchas veces se sentía agotada. A pesar de ello continúa adelante y espera que su negocio siga creciendo con el paso del tiempo. Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy tranquila por el gran apoyo que le están brindando ya que siente que de esa forma su progreso económico y familiar continuará en ascenso, agradece por la solidaridad que ha recibido en su grupo y por toda la orientación que le ha otorgado su asesor eso la motiva a seguir esforzándose para cumplir con el pago puntual de todas sus cuotas. El monto solicitado de 1000 lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como 1 saco de arroz, azúcar, 3 cajas de leche chica, 2 cajas de leche grande, pan, huevos, aceites, plátano, cebollas, harina.
texts.en:
Olga, 49, is a hardworking, dedicated woman who has lived with her spouse for many years; they have three children together.  She lives with her family and sister in her own house that she acquired thanks to the joint efforts of all the people sharing the house.

Olga sells groceries.  Her work consists in putting basic staple items up for sale.  She sells rice, sugar, eggs, bread, bananas, tomatoes, onions and others.  Her business is located in a space she set aside for it at home and she works every day providing kind, gracious service.  She’s been in business more than six year and thanks to it is able to cover her family’s and her children’s basic needs in general.  She feels very happy because she’s able to contribute to her home’s economy and her income improves every day although sometimes she felt like giving up because she was unused to working all day and sometimes she was exhausted.

Nevertheless, she continues forward and hopes in time her business will continue to grow.  This is her 5th MFP loan and she’s very at ease with the great support she’s getting because she feels that this way her economic and family progress will continue to rise.  She is thankful for the support she’s gotten from her group and for all the guidance she’s gotten from the advisor; this motivates her to continue striving to be punctual with her installment payments.

She will use the requested 1000 to buy groceries like: 1 sack of rice, sugar, three boxes of small containers of milk, two boxes of large containers of milk, bread, eggs, oil, bananas, onions and flour.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Layal

texts.en: Layal is a 29-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She has 2 children and has requested a 1,000 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and to buy some furniture. in the future, Layal is looking forward to improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Asala Group

texts.en: This group is called Asala. It consists of four ladies. They live in Hodiedh, Yemen. The members of group are very trustworthy, responsible, and hard working. They have all known each other for a long time and know each other well. They have many clients, mostly women. The whole group took a loan of 80,000 YER. Salha is a 56-year-old married woman and has 10 children. She has been operating a business of clothing, perfume, and incense sales for 15 years. She started her business when her husband died so she could continue providing her children`s expenses. She requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB which she will use to buy clothes, incense and perfumes so that she can provide her customers with a wider selection and better quality product.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is 34 years old and lives in the Zestaponi district of West Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband, her two children (who are 11 and 12 years old) and her parents-in-law. Ekas’s husband works as an artisan and her parents-in-law are pensioners. Both of her children go to the local school.

Eka runs the family's agricultural business. She owns a milk cow, and uses its milk to make cheese products.  The family also has two hectares of land and a vineyard where they grow different kinds of vegetables and harvest grapes in the late summer. In addition, Eka is involved in poultry farming and grows chickens. She sells an average of 500 chicks per month, along with the cheese and grapes. 

Eka is a hard-working young woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is requesting this loan to buy materials to build a greenhouse. She will use the greenhouse to grow vegetables year-round, and will sell her produce to retailers. The greenhouse will provide the family with a much larger income and allow Eka to reinvest her profits in family agricultural activities and improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 53 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora. Viuda, pero vive con sus hijos en su casa propia que construyó con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Desde ahí se esfuerza a diario para brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos para que puedan ser personas de bien en el futuro. El trabajo de Doris consiste en la elaboración de carbón, alquila un espacio de terreno en una lejana zona de la ciudad, siendo éstos cedidos para cumplir esta función y desde ahí trabaja diariamente. Su función consiste con la compra de restos de madera descartada que obtiene en los aserraderos aledaños, luego instala hornos artesanales en donde coloca toda la madera obtenida, los cubre con aserrín, luego lo prende y espera durante algunas semanas hasta que la madera alcance su punto óptimo de horneado para convertirse en carbón. Lleva en este negocio más de 3 años y asegura que es una actividad muy sacrificada pero rentable. Trabaja con el apoyo de tres obreros y eventualmente con el apoyo de su yerno. Por otro lado, también se dedica en la venta de comida en su casa durante las noches. Le gusta su labor, ya que puede trabajar y sentirse útil para su familia, le agrada sentir que tiene mucho más que dar para los demás, por si fuera poco asegura que el trato directo con las personas es lo que mas le gusta hacer. Afortunadamente le va muy bien porque obtiene siempre una buena producción y eso lo ayuda a aumentar sus ganancias, por tanto espera que su negocio se mantenga con el mismo ritmo de progreso. Este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado de 2,500 soles, comprará diversos cajones de madera y comprará una camionada de aserrín.
texts.en:
Doris, 53, is a kind, very hardworking woman.  She’s a widow but lives with her children in her own house she built with much effort and dedication.  She strives daily from there to provide the best for her children so that they will be happy people in the future.  

Doris’ work consists in manufacturing charcoal.  She leases space in a field that’s in a far distant part of the city that is set aside for this type of function and she works there every day.  Her work consists in buying discarded pieces of wood from nearby sawmills.  She then installs artisanal ovens she puts the acquired wood into and covers it with sawdust.  Then she lights it and waits a few weeks for the wood to reach its optimum baking stage and become charcoal.

She’s been in this business more than three years and she states that it’s very hard but profitable work.  She has help from three day laborers and occasionally her son-in-law helps her too.  On the other hand, she also sells food from home in the evening.  She likes her work because she’s able to work and feel useful for her family.  It pleases her to feel that she has much more to give for others and if this weren’t enough she insists that dealing with people directly is what she most likes to do.  Fortunately, she does well because she always obtains a good production and this helps her to increase profits so she hopes her business will maintain this same pace of progress.

This is her 6th MFP loan and she’s very happy with the financial support she’s getting because she’ll feel confident about making progress with her work.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because they are all very responsible and mutually supportive.  She will use the 2,500 soles to buy various wood crates and to buy a truckload of sawdust.

loans.use: to buy wood crates and a truckload of sawdust.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Vicentina, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose al comercio de verduras en general y los comercializa en los mercados de la región de Puerto Maldonado. Vicentina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como tomates, zanahorias, habas, arvejas, papas etc. Vicentina desea hacer crecer su actividad económica y por ello el dinero que gana, lo re invierte en su actividad  y le permite cumplir con el cronograma de pagos de sus préstamos.
texts.en: The partner is Mrs. Vicentina, and she belongs to the bank of "Las Triunfadores" in the Andahuaylillas district in the province of Quispicanchis of Cusco, Peru. The partner is a very hardworking woman and she remains dedicated to trade of vegetables and general trade in the markets in the Puerto Maldonado region. This time Vincentina is requesting a loan to buy goods such as tomatoes, carrots, lima beans, peas, potatoes etc. Vincentina wants to grow her business and with the money she makes, she reinvests it in her business, which allows her to meet the payment schedule of her loans.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, lima beans, peas, potatoes etc.

loans.name: Marixa Del Socorro

texts.es: Socia microempresaria de éxito como es Marixa mujer de 39 años de edad se dedica al destace de res desde hace 4 años, mujer casada con un hijo, su esposo trabaja con ella en el destace de la res más un ayudante que recibe salario por lo que hace, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de reses para el destace.
texts.en:
Marixa, 39, is a successful micro-entrepreneur member who has made a living butchering beef for four years.  She's married and has one child.  Her husband works with her butchering the cattle, as does a helper who receives a salary for his work.

She'll invest the loan in buying cattle to butcher.

loans.use: to buy cattle to butcher

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, de 46 años, es un hombre muy alegre y responsable, él convive con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos y juntos habitan en su casa propia junto a los miembros de su familia. El trabajo de Santos consiste en la elaboración de carbón. Alquila un espacio de terreno en una lejana zona de la ciudad en donde trabaja diariamente. Su trabajo consiste con la compra de madera descartadas en los aserraderos aledaños, luego instala hornos artesanales en donde coloca toda la madera obtenida, los cubre con aserrín, luego lo prende y espera durante algunas semanas hasta que la madera alcance su punto óptimo de horneado para convertirse en carbón. Lleva en este negocio más de 3 años y asegura que es una actividad muy sacrificada pero rentable. Trabaja con el apoyo de dos obreros y eventualmente con el apoyo de su suegra. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que puede trabajar con algunos miembros de su familia, además está constantemente divirtiéndose con las amenas conversaciones que tiene con los dueños de otros hornos de su sector mientras esperan el producto terminado. Afortunadamente le va muy bien porque obtiene siempre una buena producción lo cual le ayuda a aumentar sus ganancias, espera que su negocio se mantenga con el mismo ritmo de progreso. Este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 3,500 soles, comprará diversos cajones de madera descartada, comprará una camionada de aserrín y alquilará el espacio que utiliza para continuar elaborando carbón.
texts.en:
Santos, 46, is a very cheerful, responsible man.  He lives with his spouse with whom he has two children; all the family members live together in their own house.  

Santos’ work consists in manufacturing charcoal.  He leases space in a field in a distant part of the city where he works daily.  His work consists in buying discarded wood from nearby sawmills that he places in artisanal ovens he sets up.  He then covers the wood with sawdust, lights it and waits a few weeks for the wood to attain its maximum baking stage and become charcoal.  He’s been in this business for more than three years and he assures that it’s very demanding but profitable work.  He works with help from two day laborers and occasionally his mother-in-law helps too.

What he likes about his work is that he’s able to work with some of the members of his family and he’s constantly amused with the pleasant conversations he has with owners of other ovens in his sector while they are waiting for the finished product.  Fortunately, he does well because he always obtains good production that helps him increase profits and he hopes his business will maintain this same pace of progress.

This is his 6th MFP loan and he’s very happy with the financial support he’s getting because he’ll feel confident about making progress with his work.  On the other hand, he promises to continue making his installment payments as scheduled.  He’s very happy to be part of his communal bank because everyone is very responsible and mutually supportive.   He will use the requested 3,500 soles to buy several crates of discarded wood and a truckload of sawdust; he will also lease the space he uses to continue manufacturing charcoal.

loans.use: to buy crates of discarded wood, a truckload of sawdust and to lease space to continue making charcoal.

loans.name: Rozneen

texts.en: Ms Rozneen is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been selling ready-to-wear clothes for many years. She serves her community well by offering a great collection of bridal dresses. She has a good client list. She is making enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has been in association with Kashf for 6 years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. At present she requested for a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase packs of clothing in bulk that will satisfy her customers’ taste and choice. She is hopeful to get a boost in her profits through her large sales.

loans.use: To select and purchase clothing in bulk that will match her customers’ taste and choice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en: Shireen is a 27-year-old married woman with 1 family member from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 JD to pay for home improvements: she would like to buy new furniture and some households items. In the future she hopes to provide a good environment for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a 40-year-old married woman with 3 family members from Baqa'a, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to buy cosmetic products and perfumes to resell to her friends and neighbors. She wants to expand the products she has available. In the future she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop and to buy a new home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and perfumes to resell

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es: Santiago es un microempresario emprendedor de 36 años de edad, con dos hijos, es propietario de una granja avícola con 8 años de experiencias el cual produce y  destaza los pollos y vende la carne a diferentes mercados de la  localidad, su meta es construir una galera más que le permita criar más pollos y producir en la semana  hasta 1800 libras  de carne de pollo, eso le permite mayor producción y baja en sus costos , el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de comida para animales como purina de engorde y crecimientos.
texts.en: Santiago, 36, is an enterprising micro businessman; he has two children.  He’s owned a poultry farm for 8 years where he raises and butchers chickens; he sells the meat to various local markets.  His goal is to build an additional coop to raise more chickens to produce up to 1800 pounds of chicken meat weekly.  This will increase production and lower costs.  He will use the loan to buy Purina animal feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es: Tereza, de 41 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, convive con su pareja y junto a él tiene un hijo de 17 años, vive en su casa propia que construyó con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con ayuda de su pareja. Todos los días trabaja arduamente para mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de Tereza consiste principalmente en la elaboración de carbón. Ha destinado un espacio de terreno en una lejana zona de la ciudad cuyas áreas han sido cedidos para cumplir esta función y desde ahí trabaja diariamente. Cumple esta labor desde hace 1 año, lo hace durante las tardes ya que por las mañanas trabaja en un aserradero, precisamente de ahí es de donde obtiene los restos de madera descartada que necesita para la fabricación del carbón. Empezó en este negocio ya que veía que la madera que desechaban en el aserradero donde trabaja se desperdiciaba, es así como decidió darle otro uso y aprovechar cada residuo maderable. Trabaja con ayuda de un obrero y de su pareja. Eventualmente vende frutas los fines de semana o cuando tiene tiempo libre. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que puede trabajar sin ninguna presión y generar sus propios ingresos, le agrada sentir que tiene mucho más que dar laboralmente, por si fuera poco asegura que el trato directo con las personas es lo que mas le gusta hacer. Afortunadamente le va muy bien porque obtiene siempre una buena producción lo cual le ayuda a aumentar sus ganancias, espera que su negocio se mantenga con el mismo ritmo de progreso. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará aserrín, costales y otros artículos que necesita para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Tereza, 41, is a kind, very hardworking woman living with her spouse and their 17-year-old son.  She lives in her own house that she built with much effort and dedication with help from her spouse.  She works hard every day to improve her quality of life.

Tereza’s work consists primarily in manufacturing charcoal.  She’s set aside space in a field in a faraway part of the city that has been ceded for this purpose and she works there every day.  She’s been in this line of work for a year.  She does it in the afternoons because she works in a sawmill in the morning and that’s precisely where she gets the discarded wood she needs to make the charcoal.

She started this business because she saw that the wood discarded by her sawmill was being wasted and this was how she decided to put it to use and take advantage of every last bit of wood residue.  She works with help from a day laborer and her spouse.  Occasionally she also sells fruit on the weekend or when she has free time.

What she likes about her work is that she can work pressure-free and generate her own income.  It pleases her to feel that she has much more to offer workwise and if that weren’t enough she insists that dealing directly with people is what she likes the most.  Fortunately, she does well because she always obtains good production which helps her increase profits.  She hopes her business will continue with the same rate of progress.

This is her 3rd MFP loan and she’s very happy with the financial support she’s getting because she’ll feel more confident about making progress with her work.  On the other hand, she commits to make her installment payments punctually as scheduled.  She’s very happy to be part of her communal bank because they are all very responsible and mutually supportive.  She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy sawdust, sacks and other supplies she needs for her work.

loans.use: to buy sawdust, sacks and other supplies.

loans.name: 07.04.75 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sơn operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Sơn is 62 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 07.04.75 Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Sơn supports herself with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up.

This is Sơn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Sơn hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Ms. Kubra is a 34-year-old married woman. She has run a small general store for the last 12 months. She offers various items for daily use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list.  Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 
She is a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide for family. She wants to grow her business; she has requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.  She then would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand for her products. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: 07.01.74 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lam has a service business selling mobiphone card. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase mobiphone card to resell.

Lam is 43 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 07.01.74 Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. Lam lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has another child who is grown up. This is Lam's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns Lam is her lack of capital. With her business profit, Lam hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase mobiphone cards to resell.

loans.name: Mashael

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Mashael prefers that her photo is not on the internet; the above photo is of her son. Mashael is a 48-year-old married woman who supports 4 family members from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for home improvements; she would like to do maintenance on the home to improve her family living standard. She hopes in the future to benefit from another loan to expand her home.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Dúo Trabajadoras Con Éxito Group

texts.es: Trabajadoras con éxito. la señora marta Judith de 29 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora por salir adelante ,ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y por las tardes se dedica a la elaboración de cajas para almacenar verduras, se esfuerza mucho ya que piensa  que cuando sus hijos crezcan ella les pueda dar todo lo necesario, ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de cosméticos y material para la elaboración de cajas para almacenar verduras.
texts.en:
Trabajadoras con Éxito Duo

Marta Judith, 20, is a very hardworking person who strives to get ahead.  She makes a living selling cosmetics and, in the afternoon, making boxes for storing vegetables.  She makes the effort because she thinks that when her children grow up she can give them everything they need.

She's requesting this loan to buy cosmetics and the materials to make boxes for storing vegetables.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and materials for making boxes for storing vegetables

loans.name: Pakanac Group

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena esta casada, tiene 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales ninguno esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa, inicio este negocio por la necesidad de tener ingresos para el sustento de su familia, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería y así poder aumentar su negocio, y tener amas posibilidades en sus ventas, espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio, y tener un puesto de venta como una tienda de ropa. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 54, is married.  She didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  She has five children, none of whom is a student.  She makes a living selling clothing.  She started this business because she needed income to support her family, and at present she has ten years of experience.  She has the financial support of her husband, who works in agriculture.

She organized a group to be able to request a loan that she'll use to buy merchandise to increase her business and have more possibilities in her sales.

She hopes to have a big business in the future, and to have a place to sell, such as a clothing store.

The other members make a living in commerce and in raising animals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres microempresarios emprendedores uno de ellos es Kenia que se dedica al venta de ropa usada y cosméticos desde hace un año el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa usada y su sueño es comprar la paca completa de ropa usada, Victor vende cajetas, gaseosas variadas, refrescos naturales en una terminal de bus de su localidad  Y Sergio vende y compra plantillos de hoja de chagüite que se utiliza para hacer los nacatamales.
texts.en:
This is a group of three enterprising micro businesspeople.  One of them is Kenia who has been selling used clothes and cosmetics for a year.  She will use the loan to buy used clothes.  Her dream is to buy an entire bale of used clothes.  

Victor sells sweets, assorted soft-drinks and natural beverages at a local bus terminal and Sergio sells crops of ‘chagüite’[banana] leaves that are used to make nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales].

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: Haya is a 62-year-old married woan from Al Hashmi, Jordan. She has 3 children and has requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for clothes, covers and blankets to sell. Haya is planning to expand her project by opening her own shop and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for clothes, blankets, and covers to sell

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is 40-year-old, energetic, and diligent woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan along with her husband and 3 sons. Her husband is a labourer and also run his own vegetable shop . One of her sons works as a salesman in a general store.
Suraiya is an efficient and hardworking embroider. Since 2009, she has been doing all the embroidery work at home. She makes embroidered materials including tablecloths and bed sheets and sells them in the market. Now she is interested in purchasing some materials for her business. As a member of a 9-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase materials like needles, cloth, and other accessories. With the profits, she will save for her family. She dreams to live a happy, healthy, and peaceful life with her family. Many thanks and best wishes to all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan from her. 

Note: In the picture Suraiya holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material

loans.name: 07.03.72 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huê has a service business providing housing rentals. Huê has been involved in this business for 6 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to repair a house for renting.

Huê is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children. Huê is the group leader of the 07.03.72 Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent. She has another child who is grown up.

This is Huê's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
 
The main hardship that Huê faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Huê hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her house for renting

loans.name: Jameeleh

texts.en: Jameeleh is a 54-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal in Jordan. She requested a 600 Jordanian dinar loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. In the future, Jameeleh is planning to do further improvements and buy some furniture. She is also looking forward to buying a house.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Sveta

texts.en:
Sveta is 55 years old. She lives in a small village of Marneuli District with her husband. Her husband is provided with a retirement pension. The family’s economic activity is a greenhouse, where cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. They do all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold at a good price. Sveta is a very hardworking woman and has rich experience in this field.

Sveta requires a loan to buy firewood for her greenhouse. After the firewood is purchased, the greenhouse will be heated properly and this will give Sveta an opportunity to grow vegetables in winter and get a planned amount of profit. This will increase the family's income and their living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to buy firewood for the greenhouse

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es: María Gloria  es originaria de Aldea Xesuj, desde hace varios años ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, este año gracias a Dios logro abrir una tienda donde vende productos comestibles de primera nececidad y eso la ha motivado a seguir luchando, le da gracias a Dios ya que tambien su esposo la apoya a seguir adelante con su familia ya que tienen cuatro nimos,esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad, espera que le puedan apoyar a seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
María Gloria is a native of Aldea Xesuj.  For several years she has made a living raising and selling animals.  This year, she thanks God that she managed to open a store where she sells staple foods, which has motivated her to continue striving.  She also thanks God because her husband helps her get ahead with the family, because they have nine children.

She's requesting this loan to buy staple foods.  She hopes you can help her continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy staple foods

loans.name: María Eduarda

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos no vive con ellos. Vive junto a su esposo quien es jubilado de un hospital, trabajo como conserje. Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, atoles, entre otros alimentos por pedido desde hace cinco años. Esta actividad la inicio con el objetivo de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, justamente cundo sus hijos estudiaban el bachillerato. 

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de más materia prima para elaborar los deliciosos alimentos; con el objetivo de incrementar su oferta y ella manifiesta que los pedidos de sus alimentos incrementaran por la referencia de sus clientes. Con la inversión la señora desea mejorar la economía familiar que le permitan adquirir inmuebles para construir una vivienda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 56, is married and has two children but one of them no longer lives with her.  She lives with her husband who is a retired hospital worker; he worked as a caretaker.  She’s been working selling ‘pupusas’ [filled, grilled corncakes] and ‘atole’ [corn-based beverage], among other food to order for five years.  She started this activity aiming at helping her husband with household expenses when her children where in high-school.

The loan will be used to buy more raw materials to make the delicious food aiming at increasing her inventory.  She states that orders for her food have risen thanks to customer recommendations.  She will improve the family economy with this investment because it will make it possible for her to buy supplies to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make delicious meals.

loans.name: Pablo Alejandro

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Él se ha dedicado desde siempre a la producción de granos básicos y en la crianza de ganado bovino y estas actividades las heredo de sus padres.  Pablo debe viajar a la ciudad que esta a cuatro kilómetros de su casa, para comprar los insumos agrícolas para su cultivo y para comprar el ganado viaja a las plazas más cercanas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres vacas de engorde e insumos agrícolas (fertilizantes)  para su cultivo. Así, él engordara las vacas y después las venderá a buen precio para brindarles el estudio a sus hijos y todo lo que ellos necesitan para desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Pablo, 47, is married and has four children.  He’s always worked growing basic grains and raising cattle.  He inherited these activities from his parents.  Pablo must travel to the city that’s four kilometers from home to buy farm supplies for his crops and in order to buy cattle he travels to the nearest markets.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three head of cattle to fatten up and to buy farm supplies (fertilizer) for his crop.  In this way, he’ll fatten up the cattle and then sell them at a good price to provide schooling and everything else his children need in order to develop.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle and farm supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Victoria 3 Group

texts.es: Dúo Victoria 3,Doña Victoria es originaria de sumpango, tiene 2 niños que todabia estan pequeños, ella es dueña de un local donde se confeccionan delantales,y ropa tipica,ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima(telas, e hilo)para la confeccion de prendas de vestir y elaboración de ropa tipica, ya que gracias a Dios les ha ido bien, prometen pagar puntual si se les otorga el crédito el sueño de ella es seguir luchando para darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria 3 Duo.

Victoria is from Sumpango.  She has two children who are still little.  She owns a shop where aprons and traditional clothing is manufactures and is asking for this loan to buy raw materials (fabric and thread) to make articles of clothing and to make traditional clothes.  Thanks to God she’s done well.  They promise to continue being punctual with their payments if the loan is granted.  Her dream is to continue striving to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave fabric and clothing.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 68 years old and lives with her husband in Terjola District. Ekaterine and her husband receive a retirement pension. Additionally, the family runs an agricultural business. They own 3 pigs, a calf and 3 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Furthermore, the family owns agricultural land and a vineyard. They grow different kinds of vegetables and pick grapes in the late summer. Ekaterine produces wine and vodka. She sells the agricultural products and dairy locally. Ekaterine is a very hard-working woman with a great experience in her work.

She requested a loan to renovate her house. Her existing house is old and damaged. Ekaterine will purchase building materials and repair it. Then, her family's living conditions will improve and they will be able to spend their evenings in a more comfortable environment after a hard day of work. Ekaterine hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Sana prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Sana is a 47-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has 5 children and has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. In the future, Sana is looking forward to improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Myasar

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Myasar prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Myasar is a 48-year-old married woman who has 5 family members from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to buy cleaning products to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. The loan will allow her to increase the number of products that she sells. She hopes in the future to expand her business by opening a shop in which to show her products.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for retailing in mobile accessories and prepaid cards

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 46-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has 4 children.

Maryam has requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. Maryam is planning to put new water pipes in her kitchen and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 36-year-old married woman who has seven family members; from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to repaint her home and to do maintenance on the home. She hopes in the future to expand her home and to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Elsa mujer de 28 años que se dedica a comercializar artículos de trastes plásticos desde hace 4 años, inicio su negocio vendiendo frito, atol de maíz, tamales y con sus ganancias fue invirtiendo en trastes plásticos y como le fue mejor se dedicó totalmente a su línea de negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos plásticos como pana, tinas, baldes, platos, cucharas etc. Martha vende platanitos ambulantes y Teresa tiene una pequeña pulpería en su domicilio y vende leñas.
texts.en:
This is a group consisting of three entrepreneur members. One of them is Elsa, a woman of 28 years old and devoted to commercialize plastic utensils for four years. She started her business selling fried food, atole of corn, and tamales, and she invested the profits in plastic utensils. Because she was doing better with that, she totally devoted to this line of business.

The credit will be invested on the purchase of plastic utensils such as small containers, large jars, buckets, plates, spoons, etc. Martha sells bananas as a street peddler and Teresa has a small grocery store in her home, where she sells firewood.

loans.use: to purchase plastic utensils such as small containers, large jars, buckets, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Eudocia

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Eudocia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa en el negocio de venta de de chicha de jora y también a la crianza de animales menores. Eudocia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar Jora para la elaboración de chicha y también comprará algunos animales de corral como cuyes y gallinas para engorde y su posterior comercialización en el mercado  de su comunidad.
Eudocia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en: Eudocia’s a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Victorious Ones) communal bank in Andahuaylillas District in Quispicanchis Province in Cusco, Peru.  She continues selling ‘chicha de jora’ [fermented corn beverage] and also raising small farm animals.  On this occasion, Eudocia needs the loan to buy purple corn to make chicha and also to buy some barnyard animals like guinea pigs and chicks to fatten up and then sell in the local market.  Eudocia is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to stay in business and by means of her work provide support for her home.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chicks and corn.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Desde hace 10 años en que enviudo Elisa, desde entonces es padre y madre de sus 4 hijos con quienes cumplió este doble rol a pesar de las dificultades, hoy son su soporte emocional mas grande que existe, uno de ellos ya independiente ayuda con los mas pequeños que aún están en etapa escolar. Habitan en una casa de adobe cuyo objetivo a largo plazo es construirla con cemento y ladrillos. Tuvo una época en donde desempeño actividades en el campo con el cual logró acumular cierto capital y cumplió uno de sus objetivos que fue el del comercio de ropas donde ya se desempeña desde hace 2 años. Es un negocio cuyo campo laboral requiere desplazarse por distintos lugares y es lo que a ella mas le gusta, pues le permite conocer mucha gente y pasar experiencias que motivan su trabajo. Dentro de los productos mas comerciales tiene actualmente los polos y las blusas cuya demanda esta en aumento y conocedora de buenos gustos opta en ocasiones por vender toda su mercadería, esto la esta motivando a seguir desempeñándose como tal adquiriendo mayor cantidad de prendas al por mayor. 
Uno de sus objetivos también es abrir una tienda de prendas en su vivienda para así crecer como comerciante.
Sus parcelas las encomendó a Edwin su hijo, quien hasta hoy la trabaja y le da la atención que requiere para así juntos apoyar en lo posible a los menores cuya actividad estudiantil superior requiere de mucho apoyo. Este es su crédito número 15 con el cual se siente comprometida y agradecida por la confianza brindada, a su vez se siente agradecida también con sus compañeros de su banco comunal quienes la asesoran e informar sobre  algunos puntos referentes a su crédito con el cual se siente confiada y segura de invertirlos.
Con los 2,000 soles otorgados realizará la compra de prendas de vestir al por mayor dentro de los cuales destacaran los polos y las blusas.
texts.en:
Since Elsa was widowed ten years ago she’s been mother and father to her four children; she met this dual role despite difficulties.  Today, they are the greatest emotional support she has.  One of them is already independent and helps her with the younger ones who are still school age.  They live in an adobe house and her long-term goal is to build it with cement and bricks.  

There was a time when she worked doing agricultural work in the fields and managed to save up some capital reaching one of her goals which was to sell clothes; she’s now been doing this for two years.  It’s a business that requires her to move from place to place and that’s what she likes best because she gets to meet many people and go through experiences that motivate her to work.  Among her best-selling items are shirts and blouses; demand for them is on the rise and since she’s a good judge of taste she often sells out all her merchandise.  This motivates her to continue developing and acquiring larger amounts of clothes at wholesale.  One of her objectives is to open a clothing store at home in order to grow as a merchant.

She left her son Edwin in charge of her fields and to date he works them and gives them the necessary attention so that they can support the younger children whose higher education activities require much support.

This is her 15th loan and she feels committed and grateful for the trust placed in her.  At the same time, she’s grateful to her fellow communal bank members who advise her and inform her on points related to her loan so she feels confident and sure about her investments.  She will use the granted 2,000 soles to buy clothing at wholesale among which blouses and shirts will be prominent.

loans.use: to buy shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Valentina, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose al comercio de alimentos como actividad principal y fuente de ingresos económicos,y tambien aprovecha para vender verduras en su puesto ambulante que tiene en el mercado de la comunidad, y de esta manera ayuda a su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción. Valentina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como papas, huevos, arroz entre otros y tambien verduras como tomates, zanahorias, habas, arvejas, papas etc.para vender en el mercado. Valentina desea poder ayudar sobre todo a su esposo, quien está haciendo los modos posibles para ahorrar y adquirir una maquina mezcladora de cemento y de esta manera lograr aumentar conjuntamente sus ingresos económicos para ofrecerle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Valentina’s a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Victorious Ones) communal bank in Andahuaylillas District in Quispicanchis Province in Cusco, Peru.  She’s a very hardworking woman who continues selling food as her main activity and source of income.  She also sells vegetables in a stand she has at the local market.  She helps her husband who works in construction this way.

On this occasion, Valentina is requesting the loan to buy ingredients like potatoes, eggs and rice among others and also to buy vegetables like tomatoes, carrots, lima beans, peas, potatoes, etc. to sell in the market.

Valentina most of all wants to help her husband who is doing everything he can to save up to buy a cement mixer so that together the two of them can increase income to provide better education for their children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Hala prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her mother.

Hala is a 26-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has two children and requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for retailing clothes. In the future, Hala is planning to expand her project by opening her own shop. 

Since Hala is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for retailing clothes

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Najat prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Najat is a 30-year-old married woman who supports two family members; from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to buy a new electronic appliance such as an LCD screen. In the future she hopes to develop her home and to provide her family with a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to buy a new electronic appliance such as an LCD screen

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in a small village of the Sachkhere district. Her family is large: She has a husband, 2 children (20 and 11 years old) and her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. The whole family is involved in agricultural business. In particular, they have 3 milk cows and 5 calves. They produce cheese and sell it locally. They also slaughter cattle and sell the meat to meat retailers. 

In addition, the family owns 1.7 hectares of land where they grow maize, haricots and produce hay for feeding the cattle. Besides that, the family provides a service for local people with their own electric mill and grinds their corn. All members of the family work hard to improve their living conditions.

Lia requested a loan to repair her house. After repairing the house, their ability to work harder will increase. Thus, it will increase their profit and Lia will be able to expand her business and satisfy more customers. She awaits your support

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Diana prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Diana is a 30-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has 5 children and requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for retailing clothes. In the future, Diana is planning to expand her project and increase sales.

loans.use: to pay for retailing clothes

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Timotea, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa en el negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, la socia compra terneros, los engorda y posteriormente los vende. Timotea en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar 2 toretes, criarlos y posteriormente comercializarlos en el mercado  de su comunidad.
Timotea está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en: Timotea’s a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Victorious Ones) communal bank in Andahuaylillas District in Quispicanchis Province in Cusco, Peru.  She’s continues with the business of buying and selling cattle.  She buys calves, fattens them up and then sells them.  On this occasion, Timotea needs the loan to buy two bullocks to raise to subsequently sell in her community’s market.  Timotea is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to stay in business and by means of her work provide support for her home.

loans.use: to buy two bullocks.

loans.name: Dúo Amor Y Fé Group

texts.es: Dúo amor y Fé. Doña Cayetana de 62 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos tipicos, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años ha sido una persona muy bendecida por Dios ya que le a dado la oportunidad de tener la habilidad de tejer ropa tipica, ahora ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos tipicos a mano.
texts.en:
“Love and Faith” Duo.

Cayetana, 62, manufactures traditional textiles; she’s been doing this for several years.  She’s been blessed by God because He’s given her the opportunity of having the skill to weave traditional clothing. She’s now requesting this loan to buy raw materials needed to hand-weave traditional textiles.

loans.use: to buy raw materials used to hand weave traditional textiles.

loans.name: Pio Xii Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socios emprendedores Zoila su negocio es compra y venta de cerdo en pie, destaza y hace nacatamales actividad que  viene realizando desde hace desde hace 10 años, inicia haciendo nacatamales la carne de cerdo le sale a menor costo su destaza el cerdo por lo que miro una oportunidad de ver mas ganancias, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de cerdo en pie, materia prima de nacatamal  como es la hoja, arroz, papa, producto perecederos, especies etc,Melenciana hecha y vende tortillas en su domicilio, Zenobia tiene una pulpería en su casa y vende enchilada, Ignacio vende hojas de chagüites para hacer nacatamales.
texts.en:
This is a group of four enterprising members.  Zoila’s business is buying and selling pigs.  She also butchers them and makes nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales], an activity she’s been in for ten years.  She starts out making pork nacatamales.
