Khorn and her husband earn approximately 33,000 riels (KHR) per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from floods is the main challenge for her rice field.

Khorn has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle, while the other member is just starting with VisionFund this cycle. Khorn completely repaid her [previous] loan which has helped her support her family with sufficient food. Now she and her group member would like to request another loan. She is going to use her portion to buy various kinds of vegetables for selling. Through this loan, Khorn hopes to improve her standard of living as well as to increase the income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of vegetables for selling

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: Sylvie est une jeune camerounaise de 30 ans, mère de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 3 ans , tous vont à l'école. Elle exerce une activité de vente de cartes et de transfert de crédit de communication dans un quartier de la ville. Avec le crédit sollicité, elle compte s'approvisionner directement chez le fournisseur de crédit de communication MTN pour pouvoir produire de plus marges et avoir plus de client.  Les benéfices générés par ce crédit vont lui permettre d'éviter les crédits fournisseurs d'une part, et être réinvestis dans la construction d'une kiosque et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition et Education) d'autre part.
texts.en:
Sylvie is a young woman from Cameroon.  She is 30 years old and the mother of two children, ages 5 and 3, who both attend school.

Sylvie sells telecommunication recharge cards in one of her city's neighborhoods.  The loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy her goods directly from MTN, the telecommunication provider.  This will help her to increase her profit margin and customer base.

The profits from this loan will allow her to avoid the suppliers' loans.  She will also be able to reinvest these profits into the building of a stall, while the rest of the money will be used to take care of her family's needs (food and education).

loans.use: to buy telecommunication recharge cards.

loans.name: Hortense's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Hortense la responsable est âgée de 46ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 24ans et 12ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des mèches et des produits cosmétiques depuis quelques années, Hortense s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but d'accroître son capital et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Hortense se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of two women who are co-borrowers, offering mutual guarantee to one another.  The group's representative, Hortense, is 46 years old.  She is married and the mother of four children who all attend school.  Her oldest and youngest children are 24 and 12 years old respectively.

Hortense has been specializing in the sale of hair extensions and cosmetics for a few years, and she buys her goods from a market located in Benin.

In order to increase her capital and to meet her customers' expectations, she has requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev.  This will help her to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's education.

Hortense is the woman featured on the left-hand side in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 10 sets of hair extensions and 5 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Savat's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Savat is 26 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are dependents. Three are still in school, while the remaining one helps with the family’s business. 

For the last 10 years, Savat has been farming rice to make a living. Sometimes her husband catches fish to sell for extra income. Savat’s current business earns her about 60,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. She can save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. Low crop yield resulting from flooding is the main challenge for this farming business.

Savat has been with VisionFund for five cycles and has completely paid back the loans. The other member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Savat has wisely used the past loans to relieve the family’s burden and also to support her children’s education. Now she is leading her group in a request for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and a portion of it on fishing nets for her husband’s business. 

Savat hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Lesther Natanael

texts.es: Lester es un microempresario de muchos éxitos emprendedor que tiene un pequeño taller de metalurgia desde hace 5 años, el diseña  estructuras metálicas atraves de contratos vía licitación con la alcaldía de su localidad. Tiene dos trabajadores quienes le ayudan a trabajar los servicios que ofrece, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como hierro, soldaduras, etc.
texts.en: Lester is a micro-entreprenuer with several successful enterprises. He has had a small metalworking shop for five years. He designs metallic structures through bidding contracts with the mayor's office in his town. He has two workers who help him him with the work that he does. He will invest the loan in the purchase of materials like iron, solder, etc.

loans.use: to buy materials like iron, solder, etc.

loans.name: Aydalina

texts.es:
Doña Aydalina inicio su negocio desde hace 10 años haciendo pan y cosa de horno madre soltera  teniendo el apoyo una de sus hijas mayores que le ayuda a vender sus productos,  actualmente a diversificado su negocio vende nacatamales mercadería en general. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como harina, maíz, leñas, ropa nueva, cosmético etc.

Posee un taxis que con sus ahorros lo compro brinda servicio de transporte a la  población y de esta manera se mejoran sus ingresos para el sostén de la familia
texts.en:
Aydalina started her business 10 years ago making bread and baked goods. She is a single mother and has had the help of her older daughters in selling her products. Now she has diversified her business selling nacatamales and general merchandise. She will use the loan to invest in buying things such as flour, corn, firewood, new clothes, cosmetics, etc. 

She owns a taxi that she bought with her savings, offering transportation to people. This way, she improves her income to support her family.

loans.use: to invest in buying things such as flour, corn, firewood and new clothes.

loans.name: Maria Pilar

texts.es: María tiene 49 años estado civil casada,  no tiene hijos. María  aprendió peluquería, maquillaje lo que actualmente hizo que esa sea su profesión. En la actualidad tiene muchos clientes desde hombres, mujeres y niños que prefieren su atención porque la conocen desde hace mucho tiempo. María nos comenta que hace 5 años atrás también empezó a vender productos de belleza por el sector laborando de lunes a sábado desde las 9 hasta las 22 de la noche. En su gabinete ofrece cortes con estilo, permanentes, alisados, maquillaje, arreglo de uñas y demás. Le gusta lo que realiza porque ese es lo que siempre quizo ser. Con el préstamo que está solicitando comprara:  tintes, ampollas para el cabello, esmaltes y herramientas para el gabinete. Espera mejorar sus ingresos para arreglar un poco el local
texts.en:
María, age 49, is married and does not have children.  María learned hairdressing and make-up, which she has now made her profession.  She currently has a lot of customers including men, women, and children.  They prefer her work because they have known her for a long time.

María tells us that five years ago she also started to sell beauty products in her area.  She works from Monday through Saturday from 9:00 a.m. until 10 p.m.  At her beauty salon she offers services such as cutting and styling, permanents, straightening, make-up, manicures, and others.  She likes what she does because this is what she always wanted to be.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy dyes, hair treatments, nail polish, and tools for her beauty salon.  She hopes to improve her income in order to fix her place up a little bit.

loans.use: to buy dyes, hair treatments, nail polish, and tools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sarong's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area in the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Sarong is 27 years old and married, with one dependent son who is too young for school. She earns a living through buying and selling chickens in her local area, while her husband is a rice farmer. They have been in this business for 10 years. Together, Sarong and her husband earn about KHR 25,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 5,000 each after deducting daily expenses.

This Sarong's sixth loan with VisionFund. She has successfully repaid her other loans. The loans from VisionFund have helped her support her family better. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sarong wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and to buy chickens to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: María Sthella

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 13, 12 y 8 años de edad, dos de ellos estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. El marido es agricultor.
 
Ella para salir adelante y con ayuda del primer crédito que recibió del banco surtió una pequeña tienda en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Su esposo le ayuda de vez en cuando, tiene un año con su negocio y a pesar de que no tiene mucho tiempo tiene muchos clientes ya que no hay muchas tiendas por el sector, ella también le da parte del crédito para el esposo el cual siembra arroz y maíz.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar todo tipo de víveres y ciertos productos de bazar que quiere vender. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of Mejorando el Futuro Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the town of Tierras Amarillas in Rocafuerte Canton.  This area is known for agriculture because many of the residents make a living in short-cycle agriculture.

This is where María lives.  She's 34 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has four children, ages 17, 13, 12, and 8.  Two of them are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

To get ahead, and with the help of the first loan she received, she stocked a small store in her house.  She sells all types of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, and fruit.  She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m., and sometimes later.  Her husband occasionally helps her.  She has had the business for a year and, despite this short period of time, has a lot of customers because there aren't many stores in the area.  She also is dedicating part of the loan to her husband, who grows rice and corn.

She's going to use this loan to stock her store.  She's going to buy all types of provisions and certain hardware products that she wants to sell.  She has had four cycles with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help they get with loans.

Her dream is to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy provisions and hardware products

loans.name: Pancasan Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socias microempresarias con éxito una de ellas es Blanca Nieve que se dedica a echar tortilla, y una pequeña pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 4 años. Lleva tres años con la institución, el crédito lo solicita para compra de granos básicos como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, maíz etc. Bertha vende fritanga, hielo, choco banano, desde hace varios años, Brenda Patricia tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, Juana María vende cuajada, echa tortilla, vende pan caraceño en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is made up of four micro business women who are succesful. One of the is Blanca Nieve, who makes tortillas and has had a small store in her house for four years. She has been in the institution for three years. She is asking for the loan to buy basic grains such as rice , beans, sugar, corn, etc. Bertha has sold fritanga, ice, and chocolate bananas for four years. Brenda Patricia has a store in her house. Juana María sells clotted milk, tortillas and caraceño from her house.

loans.use: to invest in buying rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef and chicken.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 41 years old. He lives in the small village of Kareli district with his wife Marina and two children, aged 19 and 16 years old. Marina is a housewife. George’s daughter tries to earn a monthly income through cosmetic products. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow, three calves and a pig.

They milk the cow and produce cheese and sell it to cheese retailers. They also have three hectares of land, on which they grow wheat, maize, potatoes, haricot beans and apples. The family cultivates the land seasonally and does all the relevant work to ensure a good harvest. In addition, George has a greenhouse, where tulips are grown. The flowers are sold to tulip retailers at a good price.

George has requested a loan to cultivate a plot of land. After the land is cultivated, George will sow vegetables, and the harvested product will be sold locally. Another part of the loan will be used for purchasing firewood to heat the greenhouse during the winter season. In addition, he will buy greenhouse polyethylene, flower seeds and fertilizers. After the greenhouse is covered properly, it will stay at the necessary temperature. 

George will be able to raise his profits during the winter. The increased profits will be used for renovating his house, which is old and damaged. Thus, the family will improve its living conditions.

loans.use: to cultivate a plot of land, buy greenhouse polyethylene, flower seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 26-year-old married woman from Sahab in Jordan with four children. She has requested a loan of JOD 1,500 to start a clothing retail shop from her own home. In the future, Maha is planning to set aside a room in her house for her project. She hopes to improve the living conditions of her family and increase her income as well.

Since Maha is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong province, Cambodia. She is 38 years old and married, with one dependent daughter who helps with the family business. To support the family, she has been growing rice for 18 years. The current business earns her about KHR 17,000 per day, and she can afford to save KHR 7,000 each day after expenses. Low crop yield has been a challenge for her business. 

Han is a first-time client with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her plantation and to pay for labor. Han hopes to make more healthy rice and cassava to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her plantation.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all her children go to school. She takes care of her mother, as well. To earn a living, she sells snacks like pancakes, chips, fried cassava, cakes, and chapatti at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

Maureen has requested a loan of  300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, baking powder and flour. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to get more capital so she can sell other types of snacks. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes, cooking oil, baking powder and flour.

loans.name: Luz  Y Salvacion Group

texts.es: Microempresarias de éxitos formados por cuatros socias una de ellas es Esperanza quien hace y vende nacatamales los fines de semanas en su casa además comercializa mercadería en general como ropa variada, cosméticos, calzados etc. el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de carne de cerdo, arroz, maíz, especies, hojas, leñas, y ropa variada y nueva. Isabel tiene un taller de costura hace ropa a la medida y en serie,  Francis se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata a empleados públicos y privado en las diferentes instituciones de la capital y su comunidad, Yamileth del Rosario vende mercadería en general como perfume, calzado, ropa de varón y de dama.
texts.en: This group of micro-entrepreneurs is made up of four members. One of them is Esperanza who makes and sells Nicaraguan tamales (corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf) on weekends from her home. She also sells merchandise like assorted clothing, cosmetics, footwear, etc. She will use the loan to buy pork, rice, corn, spices, banana leaves, firewood, and assorted new clothing. Isabel has a sewing shop where she makes tailored and off-the-rack clothing. Francis works selling silver jewelry to public and private employees in various institutions in the capital and in her community. Yamileth de Rosario sells general merchandise like perfume, footwear, and men's and women's clothing.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing, corn, rice, banana leaves, spices, pork, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Alicia Y Helen Group

texts.es:
DÚO ALICIA Y HELEN
Este grupo está a cargo de la señora Alicia quien tiene una tienda en su casa, también se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y refacciones, ella tiene 51 años de edad y le gusta mucho vender.  Sus dos hijos ya están casados, le da gracias a Dios porque a cada día muchas personas la visitan para comprar en su tienda, la cual está ubicada en un callejón de la calle principal de su comunidad. esta solicitando el crédito ya que Se aproximan las fechas navideñas y quiere comprar frutas y especies para la venta. ya que el dinero que ella tiene no le alcanza por eso hace una solicitud de su tercer crédito para poder comprar lo que le hace falta y así vender ya que las ventas son su alegría y cada cliente que la visita es un nueva amistad para ella.
texts.en:
ALICIA AND HELEN DUO

This group is led by Alicia, who has a store in her house. She also sells lunches and repalcement parts. She is 51 years old and she really likes sales. Her two children are married and she thanks God every day, because a lot of people visit to shop in her store. It is located on the main street in her community. She is asking for the loan because the Christmas season is approaching and she wants to buy fruits and spices to sell. The money she has isn't enough and that is why she is applying for her third loan to buy what she needs. This way she can sell, since sales are her joy and each customer that visits her is a new friend for her.

loans.use: to buy fruit and spices to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 22-year-old young woman. She is from a small village in the Sachkhere district. She has a large family: a husband, two infant children and a mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. 

Mariam’s husband is an artisan and gets a monthly income from his work. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, a plot of land, where it grows maize and haricot beans. The family cultivates the land seasonally and does all the relevant work to improve its living conditions. 

Mariam has requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing the cow, Mariam will produce dairy products, which will be sold and will provide the family with an additional source of income. The increased income will help the family to develop its business. Mariam awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Kang Meas district, Han is 53 years old. She is a widowed mother of five children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. She has struggled to feed her children by selling groceries and various kinds of fruit. Sometimes Han also sells rice to add up more income for the family. She earns about US$8 per day and manages to save about US$3 each day for future needs. 

Han has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already, and she wisely and successfully used her first loan to make her living conditions better. Now she is applying for another loan of US$700 to buy various kinds of fruit to resell, such as mangoes, durians, etc. Han hopes to increase her income from her fruit-selling business to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of fruit for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Soer

texts.en:
Soer, 36, is a married mother living in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a hard-working farmer who grows rice and beans on three hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for 10 years. With hard work, Soer can earn about KHR 36,000 per day and save about KHR 20,000 each day for her future needs. The low price of her crop yield is still the main challenge.

This is Soer's first microloan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of KHR 2,500,000. With this loan, she will buy a bean-harvesting machine to help her thresh her beans. Soer hopes to grow more beans and rice and increase her family’s income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a bean-harvesting machine.

loans.name: Ouch's Group

texts.en:
Ouch, 48, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham Province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, three of whom are dependents and still attending school. For the last ten years, Ouch has been planting cassava, while her husband has worked as a construction worker in the local area. 

Ouch has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles already and she has completely repaid her loans. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood and support her current business. After the four cycles with VisionFund, she now can earn about 13,000 KHR per day to respond to her family’s needs. She manages to save about about 5,000 KHR each day for her future needs. Now, she is leading her group of two to request another loan. Ouch, the group's leader, will use her portion to buy insecticides for protecting her farmland. She hopes to grow her cassava fruitfully and timely so she can sell it at a good price and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy insecticides for protecting her farmland.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 34-year-old married female from Sahab, Jordan. She has 4 children and requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and buying some furniture. 

In the future, Hayat is planning to do further home improvements such as painting. Hayat wants to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Dúo El Shaday De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Shaday de San Mateo 
Este dúo está conformado por doña Gloria Marisol, ella tiene 33 años de edad y tiene al bendicion de contar con tres hijas mujeres la mayor es de 9 años y la más pequeña de 5 años, las  tres estudian en la escuelita local de san mateo, doña gloria se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de ejote y arveja  ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión  de compra de abono  y semilla de ejote,  ella comenta que regularmente trabaja sola ya que su esposo trabaja en Guatemala y llega los fines de semana a su casa entonces para sus cultivos contrata a dos obreros para que la ayuden, su anhelo en la vida es que sus niñas crezcan y sobre todo que tengan la oportunidad de estudiar ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de hacerlo. espera que por medio de ustedes y del crédito ella pueda seguir con su actividad.
texts.en:
“Duo Shady” of San Mateo is comprised of Gloria Marisol. She is 33 years old and is fortunate to have three daughters the oldest of which is 9 years old and the youngest is 5 years old.  The three of them study in the small school located in San Mateo. 

Gloria works in agriculture, specifically seeding corn and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of manure and corn seeds. She mentioned that she regularly works alone now that her husband works in Guatemala and comes for weekends for his crops. He hires two workers to help him. 

Her longing in life is that her daughters grow up and more than anything else have the opportunity to study because she did not have the opportunity.  She hopes that through you and the credit she can continue her activities.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds and manure

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Shireen prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; therefore, the above photo is of her husband. 

Shireen is a 26-year-old married woman from Al Karak Jordan who has 2 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to buy new electronic appliances and repaint her home. In the future, she would like to provide her family a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 3 family members and is from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy a new furniture, such as some for her living room. 

In the future she hopes to buy more furniture to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old, married man from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan, who has two family members. He is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for his home improvements. He wants to repaint his home and to do maintenance of the home.

He hopes, in the future, to buy new furniture to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements

loans.name: Dúo Dios Es Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
DÚO DIOS ES MI GUIA
Iris Aracely, de 20 años de edad es la encargada del grupo, ella vive en Aldea Vista Hermosa de San Pedro Sacatepequez, con el apoyo incomparable de su hermano se dedica a la confección de Ropa (blusas de diferentes tallas y colores), los pedidos de blusas están creciendo pero no le alcanza la tela que tiene la cual ella la compra por rollo y usa siete colores para confeccionar estilos y colores de blusas, cada rollo de tela le cuesta Q. 1000.00 y el poco capital que tiene no le alcanza para comprar más tela.  Por eso ella hace una solicitud de un nuevo crédito para poder comprar más tela y completar sus pedidos y no fallarle a sus clientes que confían en ella haciendo sus pedidos.
texts.en:
DÚO DIOS ES MI GUIA
Iris Aracely, 20, is the leader of the group. She lives in the village Vista Hermosa in San Pedro Sacatepequez. With the unparalleled support of her brother, she works making clothing (blouses of different sizes and colors). Her orders for blouses are increasing, but she doesn't have the fabric that she needs. She buys it by the roll and uses seven colors to make different styles and colors of blouses. Each roll of fabric costs 1,000 Guatemalan quetzals and the little capital she has is not enough to buy more fabric. This is why she applying for a new loan to be able to buy more fabric, fill her orders, and not fail her customers who trust her to fill them.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make blouses.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 39 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Elfio, con quien tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró desde hace 13 años. Desde hace 21 años dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo en la agricultura sus principales cultivos constan de, papa, habas, alverja, cebada y maíz, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas. “Las ganancias que se obtienen son inestables, tienes que esperar la cosecha para ver el resultado del dinero invertido”, comenta. Es por esa razón que se dedica a la ganadería, posee 2 vacas, 2 toros, gallinas y cerdos, los cuales vende a los carniceros cuando están maduros, de este negocio puede obtener ganancias estables y de manera constante. Ahora desea comprar vacas lecheras para poder incursionar en la venta de leche pura, ya que una empresa procesadora de leche, está comprando a los ganaderos de la zona. Este es El octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero recibido durante todo este tiempo, por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Silvia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de una vaca lechera, para dar el primer paso en el negocio que piensa desarrollar.
texts.en:
Silvia, 39 years old, is a simple woman. She lives with her husband Elfio, with whom she has 3 children that she cares for in a house she bought some 13 years ago. Since Silvia was 21 years old, she has dedicated her time and efforts to agriculture, and her principle crops are potatoes, beans, peas, onions, and corn, which she sows in her own agricultural fields. “The earnings we gain are unstable; we have to await the harvest to see the results of the money invested,” she comments.

That is why Silvia also dedicates time to cattle raising. She has 2 cows, 2 bulls, hens, and pigs, which she sells to butchers when they are mature. From this business Silvia can obtain stable earnings in a constant manner. Now she wishes to buy milk cows so that she can enter into the business of selling pure milk. A milk processing enterprise has begun buying milk from the zone's dairy farmers.

This is Silvia's 8th loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial help received during all this time. For that reason, she promises to be punctual in making her payments, plus the fact that her fellow members are responsible and supportive persons. Silvia will invest the money in purchasing a milk cow and take the first step in this new business she wants to develop.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and begin selling milk.

loans.name: Widad

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Widad prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. The above photo is of her son. 
Widad is a 56 year old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. She has three family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for home improvements. She wants to improve and develop her home by buying new furniture and some household items. She would also like to repaint her home. In the future she hopes to create a comfortable space for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old married man from Jubaiha, Jordan. He has two children. 

He has requested a 1,500 JOD loan to buy goods for his grocery store. 

In the future, Mahmoud plans to have his family members participate in his project.

loans.use: to buy goods for his grocery store.

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en:
Marriam is a 44-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan. She has three family members.

She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to buy various products such as clothes, perfumes, cosmetic products and cleaning products to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. 

She hopes to expand her project in the future by opening a shop, and to enable her sons to continue their education.

loans.use: to buy various products to resell to her friends and neighbours.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en: Ms. Sumaira is a 30-year-old married woman and mother of six. Twelve years ago she started stitching in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her second loan cycle and has borrowed Rs. 25,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc., to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tiles and cement for a ceiling making business.

loans.name: Mtvarisa

texts.en:
Mtvarisa is a 34-year-old woman from a small village in the Sachkhere district. She lives with her husband and two infant children. Her husband is a welder and gets a monthly income from his work.

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, it owns a plot of land, on which different vegetables are grown. The family does all the relevant seasonal work to ensure a good harvest.

In addition, the family runs a small dairy farm with four milk cows. The milk is used in dairy products.  

Besides that, Mtvarisa owns a vineyard and picks grapes in the late summer. She is a very hard-working young woman with a great desire to get ahead.

Mtvarisa has requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing the cow, she will be able to produce more dairy and increase her milk products. This will significantly increase the family income. The increased income will help the family to improve its living conditions. 

Mtvarisa is awaiting your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Izdehar

texts.en: Izdehar is a 34-year-old married woman, who has two family members, from Madaba in Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy chickens and eggs to resell in the same area. She wants to increase the number she sells. She hopes to expand her project in the future, by opening a shop.

loans.use: to buy chickens and eggs to resell

loans.name: Al-Rbah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Rbah, which consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The group has applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is 41 years old and married. She has been working as a vendor at the market, and has been selling fruit and vegetables for many years.

She started her business with small capital and would now like to increase her sales volume. She has requested a loan of 20,000 YER (being a portion of the Al-Rbah group loan) in order to purchase more stock to sell, such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions, grapes and apples.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell in her market stall, such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions, grapes and apples.

loans.name: Thoraya

texts.en:
Thoraya is a 51-year-old married female from Al Nasser, Jordan. She has five children.

She has requested a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements and painting expenses. In the future, Thoraya plans to buy some furniture and make further amendments. She is also looking forward to improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements and painting expenses.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old married male from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. He has a child.

He has requested a loan of 700 JOD to pay for opening a grocery store in one of the rooms in his house. In the future, Ahmad is planning to expand his project, and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for opening a grocery store in one of the rooms in his house.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es: Socias formada por tres socias de éxito una de ellas Rosa Betania tiene una pequeña fábrica de mechas de lampazos desde hace 10 años, cuenta con tres empleados quienes ganan por producción, los productos los vende a diferentes mercados y empresas aledañas a su domicilio el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como hilos etc. Margarita micro empresaria de éxito  hace dos años su casa se le quemo quedando a la intemperie con ayuda de amistades, y amigos fue restaurando su casa, su negocio es venta de tortillas, cerdo frito, chicharon, morongas, gaseosas, jugos etc. sin embargo nunca tuvo atrasos en sus pagos de sus cuotas del préstamo, Noelia es cliente nueva en este ciclo se dedica a la comercialización de ropa usada y artículos de librerías.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three successful members.  Rosa Betania is one of them.  She has had a small factory making mop heads for ten years.  She has three employees, who earn according to production.  The products are sold at different markets and businesses in the areas surrounding her home.  She will use the loan to buy raw material like string, etc.

Margarita is a successful small businesswoman.  Two years ago her house burned, leaving her exposed to the weather.  With help from friends, her house was restored.  Her business is selling tortillas, fried pork, deep-fried pork rinds, blood sausage, soft drinks, and juice, etc.  Nevertheless, she was never behind in her loan payments.

Noelia is a new client this cycle.  She sells used clothes and bookstore items.

loans.use: to buy raw material like string, etc

loans.name: Dúo Rosario Group

texts.es:
DÚO ROSARIO 
Este grupo está compuesto por doña Mirna Susana, quien es la líder, ella tiene 36 años de edad , tiene 3 hijos que todavia estan solteros,ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y a la venta de ropa de niños y adultos, también ella hace cortes de pelo,  en su local.  Hoy en día varias personas la visitan porque ofrece diferentes tipos de cosméticos y en gran cantidad, como cremas, perfumes, talcos y más.  También las muchachas le piden muchos pantalones y suéteres, pero a ella no le alcanza el poco dinero que tiene, por tal motivo desea hacer una nueva solicitud para poder comprar más Cosmeticos y ropa y así ofrecerle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
DÚO ROSARIO 

The leader of this group is doña Mirna Susana.  She is 36 and has three children, who are all single.  She sells cosmetics and clothing for children and adults.  She also does haircuts at home,  Many people visit her these days because she offers many different types of cosmetics in large quantities, such as creams, perfumes, powders, and so on. The women also ask her for pants and sweaters.  But she does not have enough money to buy these, so she is seeking a new loan to buy cosmetics and clothing for her clients.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and different sizes of clothing.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Ms. Robina is 29 years old and is a vigorous married woman. She has had a beauty parlor business for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. 

But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is doing waste yarn selling, but he does not work due to a recession of work here in Pakistan and could not earn enough to support his family well. Robina's beauty parlor is small but fulfills the needs of local community, and she is the highest earner in her household. 

She is a mother of three children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 25000 to buy more products for skin care, hair treatment, and make-up kits to cater to more customers at a time. She shared her dream of running a training school in her community. She is teaching make-up and hair styling skills to two students at this time so they can help her expand her business, as well as earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy more products for skin care, hair treatment, and make-up kits

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 36-year-old married woman. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Three years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

She is married and provides for 5 children. She is currently in her 2nd loan cycle and has borrowed Rs 20,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including reels of threads in different colors and packs of laces, buttons and zippers, etc., to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She dreams of providing a good quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw material including reels of threads in different colors and packs of laces, buttons and zippers, etc.,

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en: Hameedan is a 44-year-old married woman. She is the mother of seven children, and is trying hard to meet their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. Her husband is a power loam worker and does not earn enough to keep up with the increasing day-to-day expenses of his life; thus Hameedan is trying to fulfill a vital role in looking after her family through her own efforts. She has been making gloves for the past 10 years, working contentedly for the sake of her family. She has applied for a loan of PKR 18,000 to buy bundles of wool and a second-hand glove stitching machine so that her daughter can assist her in completing orders on time.  It’s Hameedan’s six year with the Kashf Foundation, and she is satisfied with their support.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wool and a second-hand glove stitching machine

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Ry is a rural villager living in Battabang province’s Ratanak Mondul district. She is 62 years old and married with six children. 

Ry has been farming rice and planting corn on three hectares of farmland for 26 years to make a living. She can earn about 30,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day from the current business and manage to save 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses for future needs. Drought and insects are the main challenges for operating a farming business.

This is the first microloan for Ry’s group of three with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR for each member, Ry will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation business. She hopes to increase her plantation production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation business

loans.name: Majidah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Majidah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. The above photo is of her son

Majidah is a 50 year old married female and mother of one, from Al Nasser, Jordan. She has requested a loan of 800 JOD to pay for her home improvement expenses such as building more rooms and buying some furniture. Majidah is looking forward to having a suitable and big house for her family and to paying for her child's education.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Karimeh

texts.en:
Karimeh is a 52-year-old married woman with two family members from Al Khaldieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 Jordanian dinars (JOD)  to pay for home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture, such as bedroom furniture, and to repaint the living room. In the future, she wants to repaint her home and buy more furniture. Also, she hopes to open a business to increase her family's income.

For cultural reasons, Karimeh prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the photo is of her son.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Al-Rwan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Rwan and consists of six ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen.

Saeedh is one of the many Yemeni women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. She is 34 years old, married, and has five children.

She has three years experience with her home-based sewing and tailoring business, and has an established client base. She is now trying to improve her business, and would like to focus on improving her own work experience and work conditions by renewing her work area. 

Saeedh has applied for a loan of 30,000 YER (being a portion of the Al-Rwan group loan) to buy sewing materials for her business. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en: Fedaa is a 24-year-old, married female from Al Russeifeh in Jordan. She has two children. She requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. She is planning to buy some furniture, and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Macaes Group

texts.es: El grupo Macaes está formado  por tres microempresarias de éxito que han venido evolucionando en crecer sus negocios para el sustento de su familia una de las socias es Karen Auxiliadora que tiene una pulpería desde hace dos años de trabajar con la institución lleva dos años el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, productos lácteos como leche en bolsa, crema etc. Fátima María tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace tres años, Sinia Maribel vende comida en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The Macaes group consists of three successful microtraders, who have been developing their businesses to support their families.  One of the members is Karen Auxiliadora.  She has had a grocery for the last two years.  She will use the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, dairy products like packaged milk and cream, and so on. 

Fátima María has had a small grocery for the last three years. Sinia Maribel sells food from her home.

loans.use: to buy groceries, such as beans, sugar, oil, beef, and chicken.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 42 años es una mujer hermosa. Vive junto a Fredy, su esposo desde hace 21 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores y a los que cuidan en la casa que heredó desde hace 22 años. Cuando terminó sus estudios superiores, comenzó a ejercer la profesión de docencia; con el paso de los años conformó su familia, es ahí que le propusieron administrar una escuela de conductores, donde percibe un sueldo mensual. Pero su sueño siempre fue tener su propia empresa y con ayuda de su esposo, que es catedrático en la universidad del estado. Abrieron una propia, desde ahí realizan los cursos que el estado obliga a todos los conductores. Gracias a su buena asesoría pueden subir de categoría de conducir y comenzar a manejar cualquier tipo de carro. Hace poco recibieron los papeles legales de funcionamiento, le falta mucho para consolidarse, pero no se desanima, pues está segura que tendrá mucho éxito.  Además su meta es abrir una sucursal en la selva del Perú, pues ahí no hay este tipo de empresas. Ella pertenece un grupo solidario y este es el  octavo crédito con MFP, donde está contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero y se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. María, invertirá el dinero solicitado en pagar la publicidad para su empresa.
texts.en: María is 42 and is a beautiful woman.  She lives with Fredy, her husband since she was 21.  They have 4 children, all of whom are minors, and for whom she cares in the house that she inherited when she was 22.  When she finished her higher education, she began to work as a teacher.  As years passed and she formed her family, she started to manage a driving school, where she earned her monthly wages.  Her dream was always to have her own business, and with the help of her husband, who is a professor at the university in their state, she opened her own driving school.  This is where the classes are given that the state requires all drivers to take.  Thanks to her good advice, they can pass their test and start to drive any type of car.  A little while ago, she received her legal papers to run her business.  She still needs to strengthen it, but she doesn't get discouraged.  She is sure that she will be very successful.  Her dream is to open a branch in the jungle of Peru because there aren't these kind of businesses there.  She belongs to a communal bank, and this is her eighth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She is happy there because she has financial support and is sure she will advance with her job.  She promises to make all of her payments on time.  María will invest the requested money in publicity for her business.

loans.use: to invest in publicity for her driving school.

loans.name: Heresvita Aide

texts.es: La Sra. Heresvita ya contaba anteriormente crédito de esta institución lo cual demostró ser puntual en sus pagos por cual motivo se le esta brindando nuevamente el crédito la Sra. Heresvita es una mujer muy trabajadora y se dedica al comercio de ropa usada puesto que tiene en el patio de su casa ya tiene 2 años a dedicarse este negocio por tal razón en esta ocasión desea este crédito para la compra de mercancía de ropa usada y así contar con la ayuda de kiva.
texts.en: Heresvita has had previous loans with Kiva partner Credituyo and has paid punctually. She is now seeking a new loan.  Heresvita is a hardworking woman, who sells used clothing from a stall on the patio of her house.  She has been conducting this business for the last two years.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise (used clothes).

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en: Myla is 30 years old, married and has one infant child. Her and her spouse manage a small water refilling service, which they have operated for over five years. She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy gallons, and to help with maintenance of the water refilling business. She hopes that the business will help her earn money for school expenses and make the family financially stable.

loans.use: to buy gallons, and to help with maintenance of the water refilling business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Iman prefers that her photo is not on the internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Iman is a 34-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan. She has one family member.

She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture, such as bedroom furniture, and some households items. She hopes to buy more furniture in the future, and to create a good environment for her family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol is a 34-year-old rural villager from the Dambae district in Cambodia. He earns a living through farming rice and planting cassava. He has been in this business for fourteen years, and this is the main source of his family’s income. In addition to his business, his wife supplements the family's income by growing rubber trees. 

Sol's current business earns him approximately US$13 per day, and he manages to save about US$5 each day after offsetting daily expenses. He has one son who is still dependent; and his son and helps with the family’s business. 

Sol's main challenge is the low price of cassava. He is requesting a loan of US $1,250 which he will use to buy fertilizer for his cassava plantation. He will also use a portion of the loan on buying bowls for extracting latex from the rubber trees.

Sol hopes this loan will enable him to improve, and make a positive impact and on his current business, as well as improving his living standards. Sol is a first-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his cassava plantation

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is 57 years old and a new client of Kashf. She wants to borrow 15,000 PKR, to invest in her stitching business. She has been in this line of work for three years and is proud to contribute income to her household. When Shahnaz was not earning, her family was going through severe financial crisis. This compelled her to use her stitching skills in a for-profit manner. Her husband used to be the sole bread winner of the family, and due to limited resources none of their three sons went to school. Shahnaz felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standard and began paid work from home. She has been able to establish a good clientele, but is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. She will use her loan to purchase a new sewing machine and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 25 años es una joven trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su papá Luis y su hermana milagros, en su casa propia. Su mayor anhelo es culminar sus estudios de Obstetricia, que se encontraba realizando en una universidad privada. Hace poco su mamá Gina falleció, desde entonces trabaja sin descanso, pues tiene que solventar los gastos de su familia. Su actividad consiste en la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, donde tiene el cargo de ejecutiva de ventas. Ahí visita a mujeres de toda edad, quienes le solicitan los diversos accesorios. Los meses donde tiene mayor demando es en junio, julio por fiestas patrias y diciembre por navidad. Ahora ella desea tener un negocio propio, donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza, su idea es ubicar un sitio en un centro comercial donde pueda tener demanda y visita de público. Ya que, como ejecutiva de créditos tiene a cargo 80 vendedoras de productos de belleza por catálogos. Ella pertenece a un grupo solidario y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Karina; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de los productos de belleza que le solicitaron, ya que tienen que ser de manera adelantada.
texts.en: Karina is 25 and is a hard-working young woman.  She lives with her father, Luis, and her sister, Milagros, in their own home.  Her biggest dream is to finish her studies in obstetrics, which she was working towards at a private university.  A little while ago, her mother, Gina, passed away.  Since then, she has worked tirelessly because she has to pay for her family's expenses.  Her job is the sale of beauty products by catalog, and she works as a sales executive.  She visits women of every age, who request various accessories from her.  She has the most demand in June and July because of independence celebrations and also in December because of Christmas.  She now wishes to have her own business where she can sell beauty products.  Her idea is to work in a mall where she can have demand and be in public view.  Now, as an account executive, she is in charge of 80 women who sell beauty products by catalog.  She belongs to a communal bank, and this is her fifth business with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She hopes for your collaboration so she can fulfill her plans.  She promises to make all of her payments on time.  She is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive.  Karina will invest the requested money in the purchase of beauty products that are being requested so they can be ahead.

loans.use: to buy beauty products that are being requested.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit (bananas) to sell.

loans.name: Las Dulces Orquideas Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Perú! La Sra. Janet es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Las dulces Orquideas”, un grupo conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Janet trabaja desde hace 3 años en la venta de anticuchos, pancita y picarones , este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio, ya que ella tenía que trabajar para mantener a sus 2 hijas y es así que empezó vendiendo en la puerta de su casa anticuchos con el tiempo se hizo más conocida y ahora también vende picarones.

Janet ha solicitado el préstamo  para comprar  carne, harina y otros insumos para la preparacion de sus picarones y anticuchos y asi poder atender a sus clientes.

Janet es separada y tiene 2 hijas. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, Janet ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos sus hijas cuentan con eduacacion privada. Janet está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  Sra. Janet is a member of “Las Dulces Orquideas” Communal Bank, which is made up of nine members who engage in various business activities.

Janet has been selling kebabs, tripe and doughnuts. She started her business when she was divorced because she had to work to support her two daughters. Thus, she began selling kebabs from the doorway of her house and over time she became better known and now she also sells doughnuts.

Janet has requested a loan to purchase meat, flour and other supplies to prepare her doughnuts and kebabs and thus be able to serve her customers.

Janet is separated and has two daughters. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has succeeded in improving her income. Her daughters attend private schools. Janet is very happy with this loan and thanks Edaprospo and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase meat, flour and other supplies.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Sokhom is 35 years old, and lives in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia. Out of her three children, she still has two dependent children to take care of. To support her family, she and her husband raise ducks and cows as the main source of the family’s income. They have been in this business for almost ten years. 

Sokhom is in her third cycle with VisionFund. She has completely paid back the past loans, which helped her relieve her family’s burden. 

At present, her current business earns her about 27,000KHR per day, and from this, after expenses, she and is able to save about 6,000KHR each day.

She is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,500,000KHR. Sokhom would like to use this loan to buy more ducks to raise. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy rice to feed her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income, so she can make their living conditions better.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a mother who aims to become financially stable so that she can satisfy her family's needs and educate all her children. She is 39 years old and has four school-age children. To generate income, she engages herself in the hog raising business, while her husband works as a carpenter in their community. 

Due to financial difficulty, she and her husband aim to improve their sources of income so that they will be able to continue sending their children to school and give them a bright future. 

Marilyn plans to continue and improve her hog raising business to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of 42,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She believes that this loan will enable her to make an improvement in the business and hopes that she will make it a viable and profitable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed for her hog raising.

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 29 years old. She and her younger brother are the breadwinners of their family of eight.

Every morning, Sadia gets ready to leave for the marketplace, where she spends the entire day going from one shop to another. Her job is to provide fabric to shopkeepers; if they like the material, they reward her by placing larger orders.

Life has not always been so mobile for Sadia. Three years ago she stayed at home, while her family was living hand-to-mouth. None of her siblings went to school and even basic household necessities were difficult to obtain. These circumstances led her to take out a loan from Kashf and she started her own trading business. Today she is able to contribute to the household income which has enabled three of her siblings to go to school.

Sadia has approached Kashf again, hoping for a third loan of Rs 25,000 so that she may buy bundles of cloths of better material to help her increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bundles of cloths of better material.

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Fedaa prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband, in her place.

Fedaa is a 25-year-old, married woman from Al-Hashmi in Jordan. She has one child. She requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for clothes to resell at retail. Because Fedaa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan. 

Fedaa is planning to open her own shop in the future, increasing her income and improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to resell at retail.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es: Madeleine, de  28 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de sus padres a quienes cuida. Juntos viven en su casa propia, desde que ella nació. Ella es una mujer alegre, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender la tienda que abrió desde hace 12 años en compañía de sus padres, “soy lo único que tiene en la vida”, afirma, es por ese motivo que trabaja sin descanso para brindar a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Su negocio se ubica en una zona céntrica por lo que tiene ingresos estables y buenas ganancias, durante todo estos años obtuvo clientes que siempre compran los productos de primera necesidad de Madeleine, quien también vende productos de belleza para niños, mujeres y varones de toda edad, ahí también obtiene buenas ganancias. Ahora desea seguir trabajando con mucho esmero y aprovechar la temporada navideña que se aproxima, donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues en su asociación le inculcan la responsabilidad. Madeleine, invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumos de primera necesidad, como sacos de arroz y azúcar, cajas de leche y bolsas de fideos.
texts.en: Madeleine is 28 and is a happy woman.  She lives with her parents, for whom she cares.  They have lived in their own home since she was born.  She gets up very early every day to attend to the store that she and her parents opened when she was 12.  "I am the only thing they have in life," she states.  This is why she works tirelessly to offer her family everything that it needs.  Her business is located in a central area so she has a steady income and good profits.  Through the years, she obtained customers that always buy basic goods from her.  She also sells beauty products for children, women, and men of all ages.  She also makes good profits from these sales. She now wishes to keep working very carefully and to make the most of the nearing Christmas season, during which she will make good profits.  This is her third credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is grateful for the support being offered to her.  She promises to be punctual with her payments.  In her communal bank, they instill responsibility in her.  Madeleine will invest the money in the purchase of basic goods, such as sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of milk, and bags of noodles.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of milk, and bags of noodles.

loans.name: Dúo Cruz Blanca Group

texts.es:
DÚO CRUZ BLANCA
El grupo está conformado por  la señora Sandra Beatriz quien tiene 35 años de edad  y vive en la aldea Cruz Blanca de San Juan Sacatepequez su negocio es una tienda  de productos comestibles  de consumo diario y un comedor que tiene ubicada en su casa, necesita otro crédito para  la compra de productos comestibles como por ejemplo (compra de maíz , frijol, maíz, y  productos  navideños)    para  poder  tener  en bodega y  comprarlo a un precio favorable , su deseo es seguir creciendo en su venta   y poder darle a su hijo lo necesario.
texts.en:
The "Dúo Cruz Blanca" group includes Sandra Beatriz, who is 35 years old. She lives in the village of Cruz Blanca in San Juan Sacatepequez. 

Her business is a shop selling everyday food products and a cafeteria that she runs inside her house. She needs another loan to purchase food products such as corn, beans, and Christmas products at a low price so that she will have them in stock. Her wish is to continue increasing her sales and to be able to give her son what he needs.

loans.use: to purchase everyday food products to sell.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery selling business

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Sokun is 53 years old, and married with four children. 

Sokun earns a living through planting cassava on 1.5 hectares of farmland, while her husband is a rice farmer who grows rice on 2 hectares of farmland. Together, they can earn about KHR18,000 per day from their current businesses and can save about KHR10,000 each day after deducting daily expenses. 

This is the second loan for Sokun through Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She successfully repaid her previous loan. The loan from VisionFund helped her better support her current business. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan, Sokun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will also use a portion to spend on labor fees. 

Sokun hopes to grow her cassava and rice more healthfully and fruitfully, so that she can sell it for a good price, and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland, to use in her cassava and rice growing business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Oern's Group

texts.en:
Oern is 55 years old and lives in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. 

Her family’s income comes from farming rice on 1 hectare of farmland. She has been making a living from this business for twenty-five years. From the current business, she can earn about KHR17,000 per day and, after expenses, she manages to save about KHR10,000 per day for future needs. 

Oern has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle, and she has completely repaid the loan. She successfully used her previous loan from VisionFund to better support her living conditions with enough food. Now leading her group of two to apply for another loan, Oern is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to get a high yield from her rice paddy so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a 45-year-old single female from Jubaiha, Jordan. She is requesting a 500 JOD loan to pay for retailing clothes to her neighbours. 

In the future, Wafa is planning to open her own shop and participate in it with the members of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her clothing retail business.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves, de 47 años es una valerosa madre soltera. Vive en compañía de 2 de sus 4 hijos: Jarol y Yulissa, a los que cuida en su casa propia. Su sonrisa es muestra de su vitalidad. Hace poco incursionó en el negocio de compra y venta de maca, gracias a una agricultora que le brindó los medios necesarios para incursionar en este negocio. Agradece a la agricultura, pues le permitió mantener a sus hijos, brindándoles los alimentos del día. Las ganancias que percibe no son estables, por ello decidió incursionar en la costura, sin dejar de lado el negocio de compra y venta de maca. Es así que confecciona prendas de vestir de todo tamaño y calidad, cuenta que gana a la semana un promedio de 150 nuevos soles, pero en navidad, año nuevo y festividad agrícola de Santiago; es donde ella obtiene mejores ganancias. Por ello ahora desea mejorar su calidad de vida, con el arreglo de su casa. Pues sus hijos son todos unos profesionales y necesitan su espacio, afirma. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nieves; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de kilos de maca para su negocio, además de telas de diversos colores para realizar su costura.
texts.en: Nieves is forty-seven and is a brave single mother.  She lives with two of her four children, Jarol and Yulissa.  She cares for them in her own home.  Her smile is a sign of her vitality.  A little while ago, she started a business buying and selling maca, thanks to a farmer that offered her the necessary means to start this business.  She is thankful for this because it let her support her children and to give them food every day.  The profits that she makes aren't stable.  This is why she decided to start sewing without stopping her maca business.  She makes garments of every size and quality.  She says that she earns an average of 150 PEN a week, but during Christmas, the new year, and the agricultural festival of Santiago is when she makes the most profits.  This is why she now wants to improve her quality of life by making some fixes to her house.  Her children are professionals and need their own space.  This is her fifth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She hopes for your collaboration so she can carry out her plans.  She promises to make all of her payments on time. She is grateful for being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive.  Nieves will invest the requested money in the purchase of maca for her business as well as fabrics of various colors to do her sewing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics of various colors.

loans.name: Elfida Paulina

texts.es:
Doña Elfida Paulina de 55 años casada, su esposo se dedica a la extracción de basura desde hace 15 años,  doña Elfida se dedica a la venta de productos Comestibles de la canasta básica desde hace 18 años, como frijol, azúcar, pastas, maíz, ahora también vende golosinas, gaseosas, jugos también helados, choco bananos, sin duda su negocio ha crecido e incrementado sus ganancias y mejorado su estabilidad económica.   Doña Elfida desea seguir vendiendo ya que ese es su patrimonio y de eso viven, espera tener su negocio estable para así poder sobrevivir.
Su sueño es poder ayudar a sus hijos, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles para seguir creciendo cada dia.
texts.en:
Doña Elfida Paulina is 55 years old, married and her husband has been a garbage collector for 15 years. Doña Elfida has been selling basic food products for 18 years, such as beans, sugar, pastas, and corn and now she also sells sweets, sot drinks, juices and also ice cream and chocolate-dipped bananas. Without a doubt her business has grown and improved her income, thereby improving her economic stability. She wants to continue selling because that is her family’s legacy and that is what they live on. She wants her business to be stable so they can survive.

Her dream is to be able to help her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase food products in order to continue growing every day.

loans.use: to purchase basic food supplies.

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
Sreyoun, 32, lives in a rural area of the Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has two dependent children, who are in school. To support the family, she works as a paid laborer at a garment factory in the local area, and also farms rice, while her husband earns additional income by planting corn, cucumbers and chilies, and sometimes he also catches fish. Sreyoun and her husband have been in these businesses for almost 10 years. Low crop yield resulting from drought is the main challenge for her family’s farming business. 

Sreyoun has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the loan. It helped her relieve the family's burdens and also supported her current business. Her family’s income is about $7 USD per day, and Sreyoun can save about $3 USD each day, after daily living expenses. To better finance her business, Sreyoun is requesting a loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, of $800 USD. She will use this loan to buy a plot of farmland for operating her farming business. With this loan, Sreyoun hopes to earn more profits so as to make a better living, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland for operating her farming business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 54-year-old married female from Nao'or, Jordan. She has a child and is requesting a 700 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. 

In the future, Sahar is planning to renew her furniture.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: La Piramide Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA PIRAMIDE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ines Marleny ella es soltera y tiene 28 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de zapatos, la socia vende zapatos para mujeres, varones y niños, la socia tiene un pequeño local donde se vende los zapatos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear con su hijo, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y tener un local más grande para vender los zapatos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de venta de ropa y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to “La Piramide” Communal Bank. This bank is located in Cusco district and belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Sra. Ines Marleny is 28 years old, unmarried and has one child. She works in her business selling shoes for women, men and children. She has a small shop where she makes her sales. She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. In her free time, she enjoys going for walks with her son. 

Her dream is to expand and have a larger shop to sell shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase shoes wholesale. The other members of the bank sell groceries, shoes, clothing and beauty products.

Ines is grateful to those who are part of her dream in this way and promises to make her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: to purchase shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Kimchoern's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Prey Chhor district, Kimchoern is a 38-year-old widow. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming on one hectare of farmland. Kimchoern has been a rice farmer for 18 years. With her current business, she can earn about 16,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 6,000 KHR each day, after daily living expenses. Insufficient water supply is the main challenge for her rice paddy.

Kimchoern’s group consists of three members, all of them women. Kimchoern is in her second loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loan, which she successfully repaid, supported her family’s living conditions. Now she is leading her group to request a new loan. Kimchoern, the group leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. Kimchoern hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mughlani

texts.en: Mughlani is 40 years old, married and has six children. Two of her children go to school and her eldest daughter is getting married in six months. Mughlani and her husband have been in the milking business for ten years now. When the loan officer from Kashf found her, she only had one sick buffalo, none of her children went to school and she was planning on selling her buffalo so that she could buy food and clothing for the family. The loan officer advised her against this and informed her about the opportunities Kashf had to offer. Today she is in her fifth loan cycle and has two healthy milking animals at home. She wants to buy another buffalo so she requested a loan of Rs.25,000, which will help her increase the milk supply in her town. She is happy to be able to provide her family a living standard that she thought she had lost forever.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo

loans.name: Hat

texts.en:
Hat is 56 years old and married with six children, three of whom are dependents and help the family to generate income by working as paid workers in local area. Hat lives in a rural village of the Sampov Meas district, where crop farming a common way to make a living. Rice farming has been her family’s main source of income for thirty-two years. Beside this, Hat also sells grocery items, while her husband supplements the income by making palm juice. Lack of water supply is a main challenge for her farming business. 

Hat has been with VisionFund for two cycles and fully repaid the loans that helped her better support her current business. She earns about 40,000 KHR per day from the current business and manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after off-setting daily expenses. 

Now, she is applying for another loan of 3,000,000 KHR from VisionFund to buy two buffalo for raising and to help in her paddy field.
