She hopes this loan will enable her to have buffalo as labor in helping her farming business, and also hopes to increase rice yields so as to fulfill her dream of buying a motorbike for her family's commutes.

loans.use: to buy two buffalo for raising and to help in her paddy field.

loans.name: Sreyream

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Sreyream is 21 years old and married. She has one dependent daughter who is too young for school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on four hectares of farmland. They supplement their family’s income by growing vegetables in the local area. The current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the family's future needs. Drought is the main challenge for her farming business.

This is the first micro-loan for Sreyream through Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland, as well as use a portion of it for renovating her old house. 

With this loan, Sreyream hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living. She also hopes to fulfill her dream of running a new business as a grocery seller in order to earn additional income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
Saroen is 46 years old and married with eight children. She lives with her husband in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Out of her eight children, three are dependents and still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice on two hectares of farmland. Together, they earn about 27,000 KHR per day from the current business and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after off-setting expenses. Insufficient working capital to buy fertilizers for applying to her farmland is the main challenge.

Saroen’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans that she successfully paid back have helped her family improve living conditions. Now leading this group to apply for a loan, Sareon will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland, as well as use a portion of it to spend on gasoline. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is a 36-year-old married female from Sahab, Jordan. She has requested a loan of 800 JOD to pay for making and sewing clothes. 

In the future, Suhair is planning to open her own shop.

loans.use: to pay for making and sewing clothes.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Karak in Jordan. She has three children and requested a 400 Jordanian dinar loan to pay for home improvement expenses. Sameera is planning to make some changes to the windows and make some extensions for them.

For cultural reasons, Sameera prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the photo is of her brother.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en: Nisreen is a 30-year-old married woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian dinars to pay for home improvements. She wants to do maintenance on her home and buy some households items.  In the future, she would like to expand her rooms and provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Leilatou's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Leilatou la responsable est âgée de 42ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 7ans et 3ans. Leilatou est propriétaire d'un restaurant depuis 03ans et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev en vue de renforcer son stock et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Le profit généré par ce financement lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant et d'aider son mari dans la construction de leur maison. Leilatou se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This loan concerns two women acting as solidary borrowers. Leilatou, the leader, is 42 years old. She is married with two children; one of them goes to school. Her oldest and youngest are respectively seven and three.

Leilatou has owned a restaurant for three years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. She requested and obtained financing from Finadev in order to increase her stock and to meet consumer demand. Profits generated thanks to this loan will allow her to help with her child’s school’s expenses and to assist her husband in building their house.

Leilatou can be seen in the left-side picture.

loans.use: to buy 20 cases of beverages and 1 bag of rice.

loans.name: Zulma Evelyn

texts.es:
La señora Zulma tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 14, 8 y 3 años respectivamente. Vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos. El esposo es albañil y trabaja junto a sus hermanos, además posee una banda musical. 

Zulma por su parte se dedica a elaborar refrigerios desde hace 8 años, pero cuenta con una experiencia de más de 20 años, debido a que desde la edad de 8 años vendía enchiladas con su mamá en el cafetín de la escuela.  Todos los insumos los adquiere en la ciudad y otros productos los compra al camión repartidor de una empresa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar, boquitas, insumos para elaborar refrescos, insumos para elaborar hamburguesas, una plancha para elaborar pupusas, salseros, pan, carne, pollo, harina para elaborar tacos y para cancelar una deuda que posee con la Institución. 

Con la inversión sus ingresos mejoraran, pues tendrá disponibles más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes. Además, que en la zona donde ella vende nadie más vende hamburguesas. Su deseo es comprar un cafetín para tener un lugar más formal en donde pueda vender todos los ricos alimentos que ella elabora.
texts.en:
Señora Zulma is 30 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 14, 8, and 3. She lives with her husband and her children. Her husband is a mason and works with his brothers. He also has a musical band. 

Zulma, for her part, has been making snacks for 8 years, but she has more than 20 years of experience, since at the age of 8 she was selling enchiladas with her mother in the school cafeteria. She acquires all the ingredients in the city and she buys other products from a business delivery truck.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy snacks, ingredients to prepare cold drinks, ingredients to prepare hamburgers, a griddle for making pupusas, salsas, bread, meat, chicken, and flour to make tacos, and to pay off a debt that she has with the institution.

With the investment, her income will improve, since she will have more merchandise available to offer her customers. In addition, no one else sells hamburgers in the zone where she sells. Her wish is to buy a cafe so that she can have a more formal place where she cal sell all the delicious foods that she prepares.

loans.use: to buy snacks, ingredients to prepare cold drinks, ingredients to prepare hamburgers, a griddle to make pupusas, salsas, bread, meat, chicken, and flour to make tacos, and to pay a debt that she has with the institution.

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: Agée de 39ans, Victorine est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins ont respectivement 12ans et 07ans. Elle élève des volailles depuis quelques années. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de combler les attentes de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter ses volailles en achetant des pondeuses, des pintades et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
39 years of age, Victorine is married and a mother of two children. Her children go to school. The oldest and youngest are twelve and seven years old respectively.

She has been breeding poultry for a few years. In order to increase her working capital and to meet consumer demand, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. This loan will allow her to grow her poultry business by purchasing egg-laying hens and guinea gens and to contribute to her children’s school fees.

loans.use: buy 25 egg-laying hens and 10 guinea hens

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene siete hijos. Él es una persona que desde su infancia creció trabajando en compañía de sus padres y abuelos en la agricultura en el cultivo de maíz, fríjol y sorgo. A los 20 años de edad se caso y procreo siete hijos, hoy en día todos son mayores de edad. Es agricultor, ganadero y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos de todas actividades, él ha podido crecer a sus hijos. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, él viaja a la ciudad más cercana que esta a 10 kilómetros del lugar en donde reside. Se transporta en autobús y tarda una hora en llegar y los animales los adquiere en los lugares cercanos a su vivienda.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca, dos cerdos, reparar unas goteras y para recolectar su cosecha de maíz y fríjol. Con la inversión dispondrá de mayor variedad de animales, los que venderá para recibir un ingreso y además que recolectara su cosecha en los tiempo óptimos. Su deseo es contar con una granja mejor desarrollada y poseer una vivienda más digna.
texts.en:
José is 61 years old, is married and has seven children. From childhood, he grew up working with the company of his parents and grandparents in agriculture, cultivating corn, beans and sorghum. At the age of 20, he married and procreated seven children, who are all adults now. He is a farmer, rancher, and also devoted to raise pigs. He has been able to grow his children with all these activities.

To purchase agricultural supplies, he travels to the nearest town which is 10 kilometers from the place where he lives. He travels by bus and it takes an hour to arrive. He buys animals in places near his home.

The loan he is requesting to Fundación Campo is to buy a cow and two pigs, to repair leaks, and to collect his crops of corn and beans. With the investment, he will have greater variety of animals, which he will sell to receive income. Also, he will collect his crops in the optimal time. His dream is to have a better farm and a more dignified home.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two pigs, to repair leaks and to collect his crops of corn and beans.

loans.name: Magdana

texts.en:
Magdana is 36 years old. She lives in a small village of the Abasha district with her mother. Magdana’s mother is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. They have seven cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Magdana produces on average 60 kg cheese per month and sells locally at a good price. They also have a pig. Magdana sells piglets seasonally almost every year. She is a very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her work. 

Magdana requested a loan to purchase building materials. After buying the materials, she will be able to build a shed for the cattle. The existing one is too small and damaged to keep the cattle there. The renovated environment and additional space will help Magdana to expand her business. It will significantly increase the family income and their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and build a shed for the cattle.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 51 years old and lives in the Kareli district with his wife. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where wheat, barley and haricot are grown. Gela also has a vineyard and an apple garden. He does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The family is involved in an animal husbandry business as well. They have two milking cows, ten calves, six pigs and ten piglets. Gela produces cheese and sells it at the local open market. He is a hardworking man who is responsible and very well known in the area for his big heart and friendliness with others.

He has requested a loan to purchase wheat seeds and help cultivate the land. After cultivating the land, he will be able to sow wheat and get an abundant harvest. Part of the harvested wheat will be used by the family and the rest will be sold locally. Gela will work hard, especially in the spring and summer seasons, to get a good harvest. After selling his agricultural productions, Gela will receive planned income and will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and to cultivate agricultural land

loans.name: Koaser

texts.en:
Ms. Koaser is a 26-year-old married woman. She is a small entrepreneur and has been running a bakery shop for eight years. She started the business on a small scale, but now she has also employed other workers to assist her. She is trying hard to improve the taste, softness and volume of the dough and to better the quality of her bread. Also, she has started the production of rusks (hard biscuits) in the bakery as the demand for it is increasing. Most of her customers live in her vicinity. She supports her family from her business.

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation, which helps small entrepreneurs like her, and now her business is flourishing day by day. Now she needs a loan of PKR 25,000 to further expand her business and to buy more packs of flour, yeast, fats, emulsifiers, and other baking ingredients. She also wants to improve the internal structure of her baking oven. She is happy to see her business growth and wants to thank all those who are willing to support her in making her dream come true.

loans.use: To buy more packs of flour, yeast, fats, emulsifiers and other baking ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Dúo Providencia Group

texts.es:
DUO LA PROVIDENCIA
Siendo su tercer crédito Kiva doña Irma Yolanda que es tejedoras desde hace varios años, trabajo que aprendieron de su madre desde pequeñas, doña Irma manifiestan  que gracias al  apoyo que han obtenido han logrado  mantener  a su disposición hilos de  diversos colores para la elaboración de güipiles  típicos del municipio de San Juan Sac. También  para elaborar  servilletas típicas, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
This is the third Kiva loan for Irma Yolanda who has been a weaver for several years; work which they learned from their mother since they were young girls. Irma states that thanks to the support they have received they have managed to keep at their disposal, yarns of different colours for the production of traditional blouses of the town of San Juan Sac. As well, to make traditional napkins. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase raw material for the production of traditional textiles.

loans.use: to buy raw material for the production of traditional textiles.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is 43 years old and lives in the Khashuri district with her family. She is married and has a 19-year-old son. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, Iamze owns a plot of land where maize, potatoes and haricots are grown. They also produce hay and alfalfa (Lucerne) for feeding the cattle. The family is involved in an animal husbandry business as well. They have two milking cows and a calf. Iamze produces cheese and sells it at the local open market. She is a hardworking woman who is responsible and very well-known in the area for her big heart and friendliness with others. 

She requested a loan to purchase wheat seeds and cultivate land. After cultivating the land, she will be able to sow wheat and get an abundant harvest. Part of the harvested wheat will be used by the family, and the rest will be sold locally. Iamze will work hard, especially in spring and summer seasons, to get a good harvest. Another part of the loan will be used for purchasing calves, and after several months, the family will use oxen for carrying hay and harvested products. This will increase the family income and the profit will be reinvested in the family agricultural activities. Iamze awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, cultivate a plot of land and buy calves.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 23 years old and a loving mother. She is hard-working and dedicated.

About five years ago, she realized that her family required the other half of the family to help in financial matters, as inflation was skyrocketing day-by-day and it was becoming hard to earn money. So, with minimal finances, she started to utilize the stitching skills she had learned in good times, back at her home. Shazia has become famous in her area by completing the orders of her customers on time.

Three years ago, demand was increasing and she didn't want to lose her loyal customers, so she took financial assistance from Kashf Foundation.

This time, she has requested 25,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase reels of thread, packs of buttons, laces, and zips in various colors. She believes that with the extra income coming into the home, she will be able to make her dream come true by providing a better education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase reels of thread, packs of buttons, laces, and zips in various colors.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Ms. Zarina is a 32-year-old married woman. She is the symbol of a hard worker in her community. Ten years ago, she started the business of stitching as she admits to the fact that both husband and wife are required to work side-by-side to meet the needs of the family members. She knows the techniques of stitches very well and has good clientele.  

In order to fast-track her business growth, she started taking loans from Kashf Foundation, and now she in her third loan cycle. This time, she is in need of 35,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees) because of the upcoming eve of Eid (the religious festival). The orders from customers are at a maximum, so she needs to buy more fancy material like sequins, pearls, artificial stones, threads, utensils, etc., to fulfill the customers' demand. She expects that she will be able to generate more profits, and hence, better support the needs of her family members.

loans.use: To buy more fancy material like sequins, pearls, artificial stones, threads, utensils, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Francisca, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa en el negocio de compra y venta de productos para reciclaje como botellas y embases de plástico, además también continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, los cuales adquiere para engorde y luego los comercializa en los diferentes mercados de su comunidad. Francisca en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas, pollos y cuyes, además de alimentos para estos y de esta manera capitalizar su comercio.
Francisca está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Francisca is a member of the communal bank "Las Triunfadoras" from the district of Andahuaylillas in the province of Quispicanchis of Cusco, Perú.  The member continues on in the business of buying and selling products for recycling, like plastic bottles and containers, in addition to also continuing to make a living by raising small animals like guinea pigs and hens, which she acquires to fatten and then later sell in the different markets in her community.  

In this opportunity Francisca needs the loan in order to buy hens, chickens, and guinea pigs in addition to feed for them, and in this way capitalize on her commerce.  Francisca is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue with her economic activity and with this job bring sustenance home.

loans.use: to buy hens, chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for barnyard animals.

loans.name: Al-Zhra Group

texts.en:
This group called Al-Zhra consists of three women. They are from Hodiedh, Yemen. All of their projects are home-based; however, they have many clients, mostly women. All the group members are considered hardworking people who very much want to get ahead. 

This group took a loan of 120,000 YER (Yemen rials). Aisha is 57 years old, married and has 10 children. She lives in Hodiedh, Yemen. She’s affectionately a part of this group, and she says that she’s very happy because her business has improved little by little. 

She is a seamstress. She started the business when her husband stopped working because she wanted to help her family with their children’s expenses and to have her own capital to cover any unexpected costs. She loves her work and aspires to continue to get more profit. For this reason, she’s asking for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy fabrics for sewing and sewing materials for her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Shadya

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Shadya prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her brother.

Shadya is a 39-year-old divorced female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She requested a 600 JOD (Jordan dinar) loan to pay for clothes to sell retail. Shadya is planning to expand her project and open her own shop to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell retail.

loans.name: Khlood

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Khlood prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her brother. 

Khlood is a 35-year-old married woman who supports two family members from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan to buy various products such as perfumes, accessories and clothes to resell. She wants to increase her family income. In the future, she hopes to open a shop and to buy a new home for her family.

loans.use: to buy various products such as perfumes, accessories and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ranya

texts.en:
Ranya is a 29-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has four children and requested a 500 JOD (Jordan dinar) loan to pay for clothes to sell retail. in the future, Ranya is planning to participate in some exhibitions in order to increase sales and improve the living conditions of her family.

Since Ranya is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khlood

texts.en: Khlood is a 40-year-old married woman who has five family members from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 JD (Jordan dinar) to buy women's and children's clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She hopes in the future to increase her products and to expand her project by opening a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a 24-year-old single man from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for home improvements. He would like to buy new furniture for his home and to do maintenance on the home. 
He hopes in the future to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Al-Kwasr Group

texts.en: Al-Kwasr group consists of four women who are friends from the same town. They live in Hodiedh, Yemen. This group is requesting a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB in order to increase the members' activity level. Mkia, 35, is the leader of the group. She has been selling clothes and perfumes in her own region for three years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a supply of fabrics and perfumes in one of the regions in order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a supply of fabrics and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for retailing in cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Muradkhan

texts.en:
Muradkhan is 39 years old and lives in a small village of Bolnisi district with his wife. The family earns its living through agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow used to produce cheese that is sold locally. Muradkhan owns a 2-hectare plot of land and grows onions and peas. He also has a cabin and works as a shoemaker in his village. In addition, Muradkhan works as a waiter at the local café and gets a monthly salary. He works hard to improve his family living conditions.

Muradkhan requested a loan to purchase sheep. After purchasing the sheep, he will slaughter them and sell the meat at a good price. It will increase the family's income and Muradkhan will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for slaughter and sell the meat.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 23-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman. Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to pay for her university tuition. She hopes to continue her education. She wants in the future to increase her income. 
Since Noor is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Alejandrina, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de comida y bebidas en su restaurante, Alejandrina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, verduras, fideos, aceite y cerveza. para la producción de su restaurante, La socia Alejandrina trabaja hace muchos años en esta su actividad, la cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y tambien le permite continuar con su actividad, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandrina is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Temblores II” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is a hardworking woman who continues to sell food and beverages at her restaurant.

Alejandrina is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies such as rice, vegetables, noodles, oil, and beer so that she can continue producing in her restaurant. She has worked many years in this business and it has allowed her to sustain her household and continue in this activity. For this reason, she is very grateful to Kiva for helping her become stronger in her trade.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, noodles, oil, and beer.

loans.name: La Concepción Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por Alma Nubia de 49 años, soltera, que se dedica a comercializar zapatos desde hace 2 años, los comercializa en los departamentos del país como una forma de dar sustento a su familia, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos, Gladis desde hace 4 años vende tortilla y Domingo Antonio desde hace 10 años vende artesanías en los municipios del país.
texts.en:
This group was established by Alma Nubia. She is 49 years old, single, and has been selling shoes for two years. She sells in the various departments of the country so that she can support her family. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes.

The other members are as follows: • Gladis has been selling tortillas for four years. • Domingo Antonio has been selling handicrafts for 10 years in the various municipalities of the country.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El socio es el joven   Antonio, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Antonio continúa con su actividad económica prestando servicio de taxi. Antonio necesita dar mantenimiento a su vehículo y para eso él está solicitando su préstamo, tiene que comprar algunos accesorios como filtro de gasolina, filtro de aire, aceite lubricante entre otros.
El gran sueño de Antonio es ahorrar y comprar un nuevo vehículo para renovar el que ya tiene.
 Antonio agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse y mantenerse en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
This young man is Antonio. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Temblores II” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru. He continues with his business of providing taxi services. Antonio needs to maintain his vehicle, so he is requesting a loan in order to buy a few necessary accessories such as gas filters, air filters, motor oil, and other items.

Antonio’s greatest wish is to save money toward the purchase of a new vehicle so that he can replace the one he has. He is grateful to Kiva for helping him develop and maintain his business activity.

loans.use: to buy gas filters, air filters, motor oil, and other items for his taxi.

loans.name: Cupido Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedora que se dedican a  la comercialización de venta de pollo ese es el caso de María de Jesús de 44 años, casada y esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 10 años el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pollo, Nubia tiene una pulpería y Raquel vende nacatamales.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members who have businesses that involve selling chicken. Such is the case with María de Jesús. She is 44 years old, married, and has been in business for 10 years. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of chicken.

Nubia manages a grocery store and Raquel sells Nicaraguan tamales.

loans.use: to buy chicken to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia Maria Luisa tiene 66 años de edad,casada y tiene 6 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de costurera,la socia realiza confecciones como pantalones,faldas,vestidos,pantalones y blusas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 40 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de costurera.La socia solicita el credito para comprar telas,tijeras e hilos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is 66 years old, married, and has six children. She has a sewing business in which she produces trousers, skirts, dresses, and blouses. Maria Luisa works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. She has been in business for 40 years. Her dream is to expand her sewing business.

Maria Luisa is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, scissors, and thread. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, scissors, and thread.

loans.name: Timothée Loétitia

texts.fr: Timothée Loétitia, âgée de 59ans est mariée et mère de six enfants qui sont déjà à leur propre charge. L'aîné a 42ans et le benjamin a 26ans. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des produits agricoles depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans les villages du Bénin. Dans le but d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Timothée Loétita is 59 years old, married, and the mother of six children, all of whom are already on their own.  The eldest of her children is 42 years old, and the youngest is 26.  She has been specializing in the sale of agricultural products for several years, and buys her stock in the villages of Benin.  With the goal of growing her capacity for inventory, as well as to respond positively to the demands of her clients, she is asking for and has received a loan through Finadev -- all with a view to maximizing her profits and helping her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bags of yams and 10 bags of corn.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Eduarda, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, pero también a solicitud, Eduarda en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, verduras, carnes, fideos, aceite etc. para la producción de su actividad, La socia Eduarda trabaja hace muchos años en esta su actividad, la cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio.
texts.en:
This is Sra. Eduarda. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Temblores II” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru. Eduarda is a very hardworking woman who continues to manage her business of selling food as a street vendor. She also prepares food upon request.

Eduarda is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies such as rice, vegetables, meats, noodles, oil, and other items so that she can continue producing in her business. She has worked many years in this business and it has enabled her to sustain her household. For this reason, she is extremely grateful to Kiva for helping her become stronger in her trade.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, meats, noodles, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Cesia Group

texts.es: Formado por tres microempresarias una de ellas es Brenda que hace tortillas desde hace 15 años en su domicilio y las vende en la comunidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leñas, cal etc., Matilde socia de 29 años se vende comida en la parada de buses de su localidad y Argentina vende leña y frijoles cocidos.
texts.en:
This group consists of three micro-entrepreneurs. One of them is Brenda, who makes tortillas at home and then sells them in her community. She has been in this business for 15 years. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of corn, firewood, lime powder, and other supplies.

The other members are as follows: • Matilde is 29 years old and sells food at the bus depot in her town. • Argentina sells firewood and cooked beans.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime powder, and other supplies.

loans.name: La Anona Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios microempresarios uno de ellos  José Mauricio tiene un taller de carpintería desde hace 8 años donde fabrica muebles de madera, gabinetes de cocinas en su domicilio tiene cinco  trabajadores que le trabajan  en el proceso productivo del producto, solicita crédito para invertir en compra de madera, barniz, sellador, clavos, Denis José vende sandias al por mayor y al detalle en el mercado municipal de su localidad, Mayerlis  mujer de 34 años vende frutas en el mercado municipal de su localidad.
texts.en:
This group consists of three micro-entrepreneurs. One of them is José Mauricio, who has been operating a carpentry workshop at home for eight years. He produces wooden furniture and kitchen cabinets. José Mauricio has five employees who help him with making his products. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy wood, varnish, sealant, and nails.

The other members are as follows: • Denis José sells watermelons wholesale and retail at the municipal market in his town. • Mayerlis is a 34-year-old woman who sells fruit at the municipal market in her town.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, sealant, and nails.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia Margot tiene 42 años de edad es viuda y tiene 5 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de rocoto relleno,la socia vende en la plaza de armas,la socia tambien vende comida como sopa de pollo y saltado de carne,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne,rocotos y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margot is 42 years old, widowed, and has five children. She has a business of selling stuffed peppers. Margot sells her products in the main city square. She also sells other foods, such as chicken soup and stir-fried beef. Margo works from 9:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. and has been in business for five years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy products for cooking, such as chicken, beef, peppers, and vegetables.

Margo is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, peppers, and vegetables.

loans.name: Norga Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Norga Alejandrina tiene 49 años de edad,es casada y tiene 3 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de restaurant,al socia prepara almuerzos y cenas,la socia tambien lleva sandwich de pollo,carne y salchicha a los diferentes colegios,la socia se dedica a estos negocio 2 años,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar para su restaurant como pollo,carne y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Norga Alejandrina is 49 years old, married, and has three children. She manages a restaurant where she prepares breakfast and lunch. Norga Alejandrina also delivers chicken, beef, and sausage sandwiches to different schools. She has been in business for two years. Her dream is to expand her restaurant. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products for cooking, such as chicken, beef, and vegetables.

Norga Alejandrina is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, and vegetables.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria tiene 30 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos, el mayor  de 14 años que  estudia en un colegio público del sector y la menor de 10 años que asiste a la escuela. Gloria empezó con el sueño de tener su propio  negocio porque no conseguía trabajo por ningún lado a   causa de la  falta de empleo que existe en el pais. Ella comenzó a vender productos de cosméticos por catalogos. En la  actualidad ese es su fuente de dinero para mantener a sus hijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, colonias etc.Su anhelo es  comprar materiales de construcción y arreglar su casa
texts.en:
Gloria is 30 years old and a single mother with two children. Her older child is 14 years old and attends a public high school. The younger child is 10 years old and attends an elementary school. Gloria pursued her dream of having her own business because she could not find work due to the lack of jobs in her country. She began selling cosmetics through catalogs. At the moment, this is the source of income by which she is able to support her children.

With this loan, Gloria will buy perfumes, crèmes, colognes, and other items. Her wish is to buy construction materials so that she can repair her house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, colognes, and other items.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Hugo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Hugo continúa con su actividad económica de distribuidor de gas domestico. Hugo en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para apoyar con el negocio de su esposa, quien se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante, y para ello comprará insumos como arroz, verduras, carnes, fideos, aceite etc. para capitalizar la actividad de su conyugue.
El gran sueño de Hugo es poder ofrecer a su familia mejores comodidades y una mejor educación a sus hijos.
Hugo agradece a  KIVA por permitirle ayudar a su esposa en el desarrollo y mantenimiento de su actividad económica.
texts.en:
This is Sr. Hugo. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Temblores II” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru. Hugo continues to manage his business of distributing gas for household use. He is taking this opportunity to request a loan that will be used to help his wife’s business. She sells food at her restaurant. The money will be used to buy supplies such as rice, vegetables, meats, noodles, oil, and other items. This will inject capital into his wife’s business.

Hugo’s greatest wish is to provide more comfortable living conditions for his family and a better education for his children. He is grateful to Kiva for helping his wife develop and maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, meats, noodles, oil, and other items for his wife's restaurant.

loans.name: Moises Group

texts.es: Inicio su negocio comprando en el mercado ropa usada por piezas y actualmente su mayor deseo es comprar por pacas la ropa usada así nos expresaba Gabriela que tiene tres años de estar con esa actividad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de paca de ropa usada, Yesica vende cosméticos y perfumen, María Teresa vende papelería abastece a los cybert café y vende comida a domicilio esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace varios años.
texts.en:
Gabriela says that she started her business three years ago by purchasing individual articles of used clothing at the market. Now her greatest wish is to buy bales of used clothing. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of a bale of used clothing.

The other members are as follows: • Yesica sells cosmetics and perfumes. • María Teresa sells stationery at her cybercafé, but she has also been selling food from her home for several years.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Justa Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BATAN ORCCO,la socia alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa como chompas,pantalones,polos entre otros,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como casacas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “Batan Orcco”. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling clothes, such as sweaters, trousers, pullover shirts, and other items. The borrower has been selling as a street vendor for several years. She has done very well in her business thanks to the efforts she puts forth each day in her work. At the same time, the borrower also raises small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens, and then sells them to her customers who request them. The borrower is a responsible and industrious individual who works in this manner so that she can move her family forward.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise, such as jackets, for her business. The borrower is grateful for the loan that has been granted to her and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as jackets, to sell.

loans.name: Ingrid Agne

texts.es: Ingrid vive en EL cantón Playas de la provincia del Guayas. Ella tiene 46 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos pero no viven con ella ya que son mayores e independientes. Ingrid  a falta de que no conseguía un trabajo estable hace 10 años tomo la decisión  de abrir un  negocio propio. Como tiene habilidades para cocinar aperturo un comedor  en su casa. En la actualidad tiene un pequeño local de venta de comidas. Como podemos ver en la foto goza de excelente clientela, Ingrid se encuentra vestida con blusa blanca y falda negra. Podemos observar que le va muy bien por lo que cuenta con una ayudante. Juntas trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Con el préstamo Ingrid  quiere comprar arroz, aceite y también  arreglar el local etc. Su meta a futuro es comprarse una camioneta para poder realizar su entrega de comida  a lugares lejanos, y  también que su comedor se convierta en un restaurante muy reconocido por vender comidas típicas del Ecuador.
texts.en:
Ingrid lives in the canton of Playas in Guayas Province. She is 46 years old and single. Her two children do not live with her since they are grown and independent. Ten years ago, Ingrid was not able to find a stable job, so she decided to open her own business. Since she knew how to cook, Ingrid opened a diner in her home where she currently sells food.

The photo shows that she has an excellent clientele. Ingrid is the woman wearing a white blouse and black skirt. One can also see that she is doing well since was able to hire an assistant. They work together Monday through Friday from 6:00 A.M to 9:00 P.M.

With this loan, Ingrid will buy rice and oil. She will also make repairs to her establishment. Her future goal is to buy a truck so that she can deliver food to far-off places. She also hopes that her diner will become a well-known restaurant that serves traditional Ecuadorian food.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil and to make repairs to her establishment.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Sergio, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Sergio continúa con su actividad económica prestando servicio de taxi. Sergio necesita dar mantenimiento a su vehículo y para eso él está solicitando su préstamo, tiene que comprar algunos accesorios como filtro de gasolina, filtro de aire, aceite lubricante entre otros.
El gran sueño de Sergio es ahorrar y comprar un nuevo vehículo para renovar el que ya tiene y que le permita ofrecer a su familia mejores comodidades y mejor educación a sus hijos.
Sergio agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse y mantenerse en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
This is Sergio. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Temblores II” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru. He continues with his business of providing taxi services. Sergio needs to maintain his vehicle, so he is requesting a loan in order to buy a few necessary accessories such as gas filters, air filters, motor oil, and other items.

Sergio’s greatest wish is to save money toward the purchase of a new vehicle so that he can replace the one he has. This will enable him to provide more comfortable conditions for his family and a better education for his children. He is grateful to Kiva for helping him develop and maintain his business activity.

loans.use: to buy gas filters, air filters, motor oil, and other items for his taxi.

loans.name: Dember Enrique

texts.es: Dember de 20 de años de edad vive en el cantón Playas de la provincia del Guayas. El Comenzó a trabajar desde que tenía 14 años en una empresa de confetis. Poco después toma la decisión de establecer su propio negocio y fue  ahí donde incursiono en la crianza de cerdos. Su trabajo es de mucho esfuerzo ya que debe levantarse a las 6 de la mañana y empezar con su cuidado. Sus actividades consisten en la alimentación, la limpieza y la venta de los cerdos. La venta de los animales la realiza los fines de semana en un mercado cerca de su vivienda. Con el préstamo comprara cerdos para la crianza ya que la meta de Dember es arreglar su casa y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Dember is 20 years old and lives in the canton of Playas in Guayas Province. He began working when he was 14 at a company that makes confetti. Later on, he decided to start his own business and learned how to raise pigs. His work requires much effort. Dember wakes up at 6 A.M. and begins his work with great care. His duties include feeding, cleaning, and selling the pigs. He sells the animals on the weekends at a market near his home.

With this loan, Dember will buy pigs to raise. His goals are to repair his house and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Al-Mhaba Group

texts.en: Nouria is 33 years old and lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. She is a member of a group called Al-Mhaba, which is made up of four ladies in the same city. Nouria is a very active woman, and she sells various items such as perfumes and incense. She works every day and she is able to make a fair profit. She started her business by selling to her neighbors, and then expanded to sell her products around the area. Nouria is requesting a loan of 30,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from AMB to buy more perfumes and incense for her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and incense for her business.

loans.name: Luceritos De Panamericana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCERITOS DE PANAMERICANA”  iniciará el ciclo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de salchipapa, venta de artículos de higiene, costura de prendas de vestir, artesanía en chalinas y mantas, comerciante de abarrotes, servicio de minibús, taller de fundición y tornería, venta de fruta y pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felisa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hermana que es socia de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de salchipapas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años aprendiendo de su hermana quien la venta de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella esta casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Luceritos de Panamericana” (Little Lights of Panamericana) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Felisa as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling clothes, selling “salchipapas” (sausages and potatoes), selling hygiene products, sewing articles of clothing, producing handmade scarves and blankets, selling groceries, providing minibus services, managing a foundry and lathe shop, and selling fruit and fish.

This loan will benefit small businesswomen, such as Sra. Felisa, who is one of the members. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from her sister, who is also a member of the organization. Felisa currently operates a business where she sells “salchipapas”. She learned this trade years ago from her sister, who also sells this product.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying ingredients. Felisa acquires her supplies at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then prepares the food that she sells at her vending stall. Working in this manner enables her to generate income so that she can support her household. Felisa is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Felisa said that she enjoys the training classes about health and credit.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BATAN ORCCO,la socia tiene 42 años de edad ,separada y tiene 2 hijos,la socia Teresa alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de fotocopiadora ,tipeos una tienda de  multiservicios,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le, pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez es profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja de lunes a viernes y por la tarde trabaja en su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de papeles por ciento y para algunos gastos personales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank "Batan Orcco". She is 42 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children. Teresa divides her time between her daily activities and managing her photocopying business and multi-service shop. She has been in business for years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day in her work. Teresa is also an elementary school teacher who works Monday through Friday, but the afternoons are devoted to her business. She is a responsible and industrious person who works in this manner so that her family can move forward.

Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can buy paper in packs of 100, but she will also pay for a few personal expenses. She is grateful for the loan that has been issued to her and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy paper and to pay for a few personal expenses.

loans.name: Muna Group

texts.en: This group is called Muna and is comprised of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The head of the group is 32-year-old Moahb, who works selling sweets. She will use the loan to buy more sweets to sell and in this way will increase her working capital and improve her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is a lack of capital. She faces challenges in her business, including increasing her client base, and she will use the profits to raise her family's quality of life. She hopes to expand her business into a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy sweets for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria owns an eatery business, which is her only source of income. She uses it to support her three children and provide for their education. Gloria acts carefully every day and makes delicious food in order to obtain a good income to provide her family with a better quality of life. She loves her family so much, as well as her business. 

Gloria is asking for a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) as additional working capital to buy more food for her eatery such as rice, meat and vegetables. Part of the loan will also be used to buy soft drinks and some kitchen utensils. She hopes to acquire more customers through offering a greater variety of food.

loans.use: to purchase food for her eatery such as rice, meat and vegetables

loans.name: La Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú. Este es el grupo “La Rosa De Guadalupe” conformado por 07 socios trabajadores, la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona, dicho grupo pasan a su 3er ciclo, en este tiempo han demostrado responsabilidad.  Rosario de 39 años de edad es separada con 04 hijos 03 de ellos aún dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y productos de primera necesidad, pues actualmente cuenta con una  bodega y librería bazar en su vivienda. Con el fruto de esfuerzo a podido mejorar su vivienda. Se siente feliz pues a pesar de las competencias ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes. Solicitó el crédito para invertir en su  bodega comprando abarrotes como arroz, leche, fideos y azúcar. El deseo de Rosario es de terminar de construir su vivienda y de esta manera ampliar su negocio. El grupo “La Rosa De Guadalupe”agradece la ayuda brindada, ya que hacen posible su progreso.  Rosario se encuentra en la parte de adelante viste casaca celeste y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This group is named “La Rosa de Guadalupe” (The Rose of Guadalupe) and consists of seven hardworking members. Most of them are residents of the area. This group is in its third loan cycle and over time the members have demonstrated that they are responsible.

Rosario is 39 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four children. Three of her children are still dependents. Rosario currently operates a convenience store and bookstore in her home. As a result of her efforts, she has been able to make improvements to her home. Despite the competition, she is pleased to have gained the loyalty of her customers. Rosario is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her convenience store. She will buy groceries such as rice, milk, noodles, and sugar. Her wish is to finish the construction of her home and to expand her business.

The group “La Rosa de Guadalupe” is grateful for the assistance that has been provided so that it will be possible for them to make progress. In the photo, Rosario is the woman wearing a sky-blue jacket and black pants.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, noodles, and sugar.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is 27 years old, the mother of one child. She sells dry goods, such as flashlights, lighters and light bulbs. This is the only source of income she has, so she needs to take great care to earn her income. Now that the Christmas season is approaching, the business requires additional capital to buy the products her customers want but, due to financial constraints, Liza is asking for a loan in the amount of amount 25,000 PHP to buy plastic wares, toys and kitchen materials for her business. In this way, she may be able to increase her income, provide her child with a good life, and save for future education costs.

loans.use: to buy plastic wares, toys and kitchen materials for her business.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: A 43-year-old, Lim is married and the mother of two children. One, a son, is dependent on her and attends school. Lim and her family live in a rural area of Dambae district, which is located in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Lim earns a living for her family by planting cassava and rice, the business in which she has been involved for 20 years. Each day, she is able to earn approximately 14,000 KHR.  After offsetting the daily costs of living, she saves around 7,500 KHR. Lim is a second-time borrower from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her first loan enabled her to stabilize the finances of her family. Now Lim is in need of money to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs. She is leading a group of two women to take out a loan in the total amount of 2,600,000 KHR. Lim is highly confident that, with the help of her portion of the loan (1,200,000 KHR), her business will provide good yields, so that she can increase her income and set aside some portion of the anticipated income to build her dream house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for exterior repairs to his house.

loans.name: Ait's Group

texts.en: A resident of a rural area in Kampong Cham Province’s Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia, Ait is 35 years of age and married. She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and attend school. Ait earns her living by farming rice, the business in which she has been involved for six years. Each day, she is able to earn approximately 10,000 KHR and manages to save around 4,000 KHR after meeting her daily living costs. This will be Ait’s third loan from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The previous loans she received helped her improve her daily livelihood, which made her very happy. Now she is leading a women's group formed with a second-time VisionFund borrower to take out loans of 1,200,000 KHR each. Ait will spend most of her requested portion of the loan on fertilizer for her farmland, and she will also use some of the loan to buy household supplies. Her only hope in the future is to be able to produce plentiful yields of good quality crops, so that she can boost her income and use the income to support her beloved family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and household supplies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old and has been running a grocery store for the past six years. She is proud to have improved her family’s lifestyle. To ensure continued improvement in their life, Grace conducts her business with patience and perseverance. She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional groceries to sell, such as noodles, soft drinks and biscuits. She hopes her loyal customers will continue to buy her goods, which will help her lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store, such as noodles, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 30 years old and single. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari store. Her daily profit, amounting to 300 PHP, is usually spent on the daily needs of her siblings, and it is not enough to meet all their needs. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 23,000 PHP to buy additional goods to sell, such as vinegars, soy sauce, spices, breads and soft drinks. She hopes to earn more in order to provide for the future of her siblings and to save for emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store, such as vinegars, soy sauce, spices, breads and soft drinks.

loans.name: Filipenses 4:13 Group

texts.es: Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada además vende platanitos en bolsa donde tiene 3 vendedores  quienes genera empleos  a cabezas de familia para la subsistencia del día a día, socia de grupo solidario filipenses 4 13 formado por cuatros socios emprendedores el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva y usada, y grandes cantidades de plátanos, leñas, bolsas plásticas, aceite, queso etc. Rosa Argentina vende verduras y chiverías, Adelina vende también ropa nueva y usada, Francisco tiene un taller metalúrgico donde hace portones, verjas etc.
texts.en: Rosa is dedicated to selling new and used clothing. Additionally, she sells small bananas by the bag where she has three sellers who generate jobs for heads of households to provide daily. She is a member of the group Filipenses 4:13 made up of four entrepreneurial members. The loan will be invested in the purchase of new and used clothing and large quantities of bananas, firewood, plastic bags, oil, cheese, etc. Rosa Argentina sells vegetables and snacks. Adelina also sells new and used clothing. Francisco has a metal shop where he makes gates, fences, etc.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing, large quantities of green banana, firewood, plastic bags, oil, cheese.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: El Sr. jacinto tiene la edad de 65 años es pensionado por la comisión federal de electricidad es casado y tiene 2 hijos actualmente esta solicitando una solicitud a esta institución para poder terminar los acabados interiores de su casa ya que esta un poco maltratada ya que desde hace varios años no le dan mantenimiento y por eso desea contar con la ayuda de kiva.
texts.en: Jacinto is 65 years old. He is a pensioner of the federal electricity commission. He is married and has two children. Currently, he is requesting a loan from this institution to be able to complete the interior finishings of his house since it is a bit run down since, for many years, he has not maintained it and, as a result, he wishes to have the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to improve interior finishings.

loans.name: Moeurn's Group

texts.en: Moeurn, a female head of household with a family that includes two schoolchildren, is a rural villager in the Kandieng district of Pursat Province. She is a local farmer who strives for a living by growing rice and lettuce. Sometimes, her husband works for others for pay, to earn additional income. After engaging in this business for several years, Moeurn is able to earn about 23,600 KHR per day.  Moeurn, who has never borrowed from VisionFund before, has joined a group of three first-cycle loan clients. Moeurn is applying for a loan of 400,000 KHR, while the other group members are applying for loans of 1,000,000 KHR each. Moeurn, the group's leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her cash crops. She has great hope that using fertilizer will increase her output and help her generate a larger income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash crops.

loans.name: Bou's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Kandieng district of Pursat Province, Bou is 48 years old and the mother of six children. As the breadwinner in the family, she has tried hard to overcome her family's hardship by growing rice on a half hectare of farmland. During her spare time, she earns extra income by working as a paid worker. Because she has several years of experience in rice cultivation, she is able to earn more than 20,000 KHR per day. 

In this group of three, she is the leader. Everyone in her group is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She will use her portion of the loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and chickens to raise for extra income. She hopes to make more income from her current business so she can save some money to buy additional chickens.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer and chickens.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Doña Nora tiene una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 17 años lo inicio con una pequeña mesa de frutas, pan, café, etc.  con apoyo de su esposo le inyecto un pequeño capital que poco a poco fue creciendo hasta alcanzar el nivel de crecimiento que tiene su negocio. Tiene una diversificación de productos en su pulpería y su sueño es que sea una gran miscelánea. El crédito lo invertirá en compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar ropa etc.
texts.en: Nora has a grocery store in her house. She started it 17 years ago with a small table of fruit, bread, coffee, etc. With the support of her husband, she injected a small amount of capital which gradually grew until it reached the level of growth that her business has. She has a diverse range of products in her store and her dream is that it will be a large shop. The loan will be invested in the purchase of basic grains like rice, beans, oil, sugar, toilet paper, soap, laundry soap, etc.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, beef, chicken, milk, sour cream, etc.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Los Ángeles, así decidieron llamar las integrantes de este grupo a su nombre, por la buena energía y esperanza que tienen en el. Elizabeth, una de sus integrantes, de 32 años, esposa y madre de dos hijos, hace cinco años decidio dedicarse a la venta de pollo asado. Este negocio le ha permitido sumar otro ingreso al hogar y con ello mejorar la calidad de vida.
Elizabeth ahora ha decidido comprometerse con un crédito para poder darle mantenimiento a la parrilla donde prepara los pollos que vende a la comunidad.
Ella esta segura que este negocio nutre a su familia.
texts.en:
Los Angeles: This is what the members of this group decided as their name for the good energy and hope that they have in it. Elizabeth, one of the members, is 32. She is a wife and mother to two children. Five years ago she decided to dedicate herself to selling roast chicken. This business has allowed her to add another income to the home and with it improve the quality of life.

Elizabeth now has decided to committ to a loan to be able to maintain the grill where she prepares the chicken that she sells to the community. SHe is sure that this business feeds her family.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance if a grill.

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en:
Sabra is a 47-year-old married woman. She has waited long to see her family move towards prosperity. She has been in the stitching business for the past 3 years. 

Sabra is currently in her 2nd loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation. Her payment record is good. This time she is asking for a loan of 25,000 PKR. In order to fast-track her business growth, she contacted Kashf and thanked God that there are people who are working to make a change in society by empowering woman and small businesses. Her business has grown and clients tend to come back to her and make repeat orders. She does her work very diligently. With this loan, she wants to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, scissors, and lace for the upcoming festival of Eid (religious ceremony) to fulfill the expectations of her customers, who want to buy new clothes for the festival.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, scissors, and lace for her sewing business.

loans.name: Teresa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Teresa del Socorro en su domicilio tiene un taller de fábrica de fajas de cueros con diferentes estilos, marcas, para todas las edades. Actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años independientes este negocio es producto de herencias de sus padres que toda la vida se han dedicado a esta actividad.
El crédito lo invertirá para la compra de materia prima como el cuero, hebillas, broches etc. Cuenta con tres empleados quienes les pagan por producción. Su esposo está de  lleno en el proceso productivo del negocio y ambos se apoyan para la comercialización del producto a los diferentes mercados de la capital.
texts.en: Teresa del Socorro  has in her house a  factory for leather belts of different styles and brands for all ages. She has performed this activity for three years independently. This business is a product of inheritence from her parents who were dedicated to this work their whole lives. The loan will be invested to buy raw material like leather, buckles, brooches, etc. She has three employees who she pays for production. Her husband is in charge of the production process and both support selling the product to different markets in the capital.

loans.use: to invest in raw material like leather, buckles, brooches, etc.

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es: Socias emprendedoras de éxito formada por tres socias una de ellas Yuritza desde hace un año inicio vendiendo accesorios de bicicleta y con sus ganancias fue comprando accesorios de moto actualmente que es lo que venden, el crédito lo solicita en la compra de accesorios como micas de pide vías, bujías, llantas etc., Susana de 58 años tiene un pequeño cafetín , y Pabla vende ropa y cosméticos variados.
texts.en:
The three members of this group are successful entrepreneurs. One of them is Yuritza, who started selling bicycle accessories a year ago. She used her earnings to buy motorcycle accessories and continues to sell these items today. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy accessories such as turn signal covers, spark plugs, tires, and other items.

The other members are as follows: • Susana, age 58, owns a small cafeteria. • Pabla sells clothing and various cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy turn signal covers, spark plugs, tires, and other items.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives in Pakistan's countryside with her husband and six children. The man in the photo is Zubaida’s husband. In their area, most of the people are involved in the agriculture business. Her husband also has a piece of land that he farms. 

Zubaida and her husband purchased some cattle a few years ago and they are in the milk-selling business, which is their main source of income. Her husband also assists in selling milk in city. Now, they have two cows and 8 goats. Zubaida takes care of all the animals at home. She is responsible for providing her children with education, health, and basic needs. She heard about the Kashf Foundation from her neighbors and wants to take out a loan of 20,000 PKR, which, with some of their own savings, they wish to buy one more cow to increase milk production.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 34-year-old married woman. Six years ago, she started her own hand embroidery business. She maintained hope and contacted the Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She has a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are in school. The fourth helps her mother with her work. 

She has gradually improved her business, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR. She is going to use this loan to buy reels of thread and packs of sequins, pearls and stones. She intends to use the profits she earns on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread and packs of sequins, pearls and stones.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en: You have never seen such wonderful Tajik folk dresses as those sewn by Nazokat. She is a 23-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. She tries to help her parents to provide a better quality of life--that’s why she began her own business sewing folk dresses 7 years ago. Thanks to her good work, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to develop her business further but needs to buy 2 new sewing machines. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 TJS. She promises to make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy 2 sewing machines for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building a room.

loans.name: La Esperanza De Metroplex Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo de mujeres trabajadoras que han emprendido negocios personales que han decidido comprometerse con un crédito para invertir y mejorar sus negocios.
Dominga, esposa, madre de dos hijos, desde hace 10 años cuenta con un pequeño snack en casa, pues deseaba apoyar al ingreso familiar y este le permitía tener un ingreso extra que le ayuda en el día a día.
Ella ha confiado en abastecer su snack con mercancía y agregar nueva para incrementar ese “extra” de cada día.
Dominga esta muy contenta con el crédito, pues ve crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
This group of women all have their own businesses, and have decided to commit to taking a loan to invest in and improve their businesses.

Dominga is married with two children, and for 10 years she has been running a small snack stall from her home as she wanted to be able to support the family and this allowed her to earn extra income to help with the day to day expenses.

Dominga is planning to invest in new merchandise for her stall and increase her income. She is very thankful for the loan, which will allow her to grow her business.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her stall

loans.name: Alianza Unida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida está formado por 12 mujeres quienes son amigas y conocidas, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, tiene grandes lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Todas las socias son personas trabajadoras, algunas tienen sus propios negocios y otras socias laboran como empleadas privadas pero todas tienen un mismo objetivo el cual es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias, su mayor orgullo es aun mantener la cultura y tradiciones que sus padres les han inculcado.

Una de las socias de este grupo es La Señora María Micaela, forma parte del banco comunal desde hace 6 años, vive por la parroquia de Paccha en Cuenca, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 5 años, sus dos primeras hijas estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es el fruto del esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal.

Doña María Micaela trabaja en varias actividades económicas ya que es una mujer emprendedora, hace 5 meses tiene una tienda, los fines de semana se dedica la venta de hornado y cascaritas que son platos típicos del Ecuador, en su casa también se dedica  a la crianza de cerdos, cuyes y pollos a los que los vende en su comunidad, trabaja en la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más víveres para tener más surtida su tienda.

Su meta es agrandar su tienda.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grtupo.
texts.en:
The Alianza communal bank is comprised of 12 women who are friends and acquaintances. They live in different areas of the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate, and since December 1999, it has been classified as part of Cultural Heritage of Mankind. The city has four rivers and great places to enjoy nature. All of the members are hard-working, some have their own businesses and others work as private employees. However, all of them have the same  goal, which is to improve the quality of life of their homes and move their families forward. They are proud to maintain the culture and traditions that their parents have instilled in them.

One of the group's members is María Micaela. She has been part of the communal bank for six years and lives in the Parrish of Paccha in Cuenca. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are 14, 12, and 5 years old. Her first two daughters go to school and her son goes to the kindergarden  in the area. Her husband works as a private employee. The house they live in is the fruit of their marriage's work.

María Micaela works in various economic activities since she is an enterprising woman. She has had a store for five months. On the weekends, she sells "hornado" and "cascaritas," which are typical Ecuadorian dishes. At home, she also raises pigs, Guinea pigs, and chickens to sell in the community. She works in agriculture and what she harvests is only used for household consumption.  

She is going to invest in buying more supplies to have more stock in her store. Her goal is to expand her store. 

The two small photos represent the three members who were not present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El Sr. Leonardo tiene la edad de 51 años el es trabajador operario de Ressini tiene una antigüedad de 10 años desea renovar su crédito esta ocasión para mejorar  su vivienda ya que hace falta terminar la barda de su casa y así tener una mayor seguridad en su hogar estaría muy agradecido con kiva con el apoyo.
texts.en: Leonardo is 51 years old and works as a operator at Ressini, where he has worked for ten years. He wants to renew his credit to improve his home since he needs to finish a fence on his property. This will provide better security for his home. He would be very grateful to Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to finish a fence

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Yolanda pertenece al banco comunal RENOVACION,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de materiales de escritorio como papeles,libros,lapiceros entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca sadelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como papeles por ciento,libros entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member, Yolanda, belongs to the Renovación communal bank. She continues with her business of selling office supplies such as paper, books, pencils, and other items.
